It is a great camera is you have the time to get to know it, but it is not my favorite.The pocket camera I like better is the Fujifilm F100fd, mainly because it has the same size sensor, will autofocus in a flash, has perfect fill flash capability ( you cannot force it to make a bad fill flash image) and seems to have a wider dynamic range with almost no highlight clipping.

Reviews.Title: Great until it breaks, then good luck...
Reviews.Author: Ignatius
Reviews.Content: If you read all the negative reviews most of them focus around Canon's horrible service, for good reason. I loved this camera and took good care of it, but the lens motor died after a year and a half of normal use.  Despite this being a camera error, I'm stuck with Canon's minimum repair cost of $150 or throwing out the camera.Doesn't say much for a company if you have to buy a 3 year warranty for its products or pay $150 to repair them.  I recommend you stay away from Canon products until they revise their customer service policies, there are plenty of good alternatives - Olympus, Panasonic, Sony.  My next camera will be a Lumix

Reviews.Title: Perfect point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Tanay Padgaonkar
Reviews.Content: 5 Stars. This is a perfect pocket sized camera. The final image quality is superb considering the size of the camera. Sturdy and durable (dropped it a couple of times in my one year of ownership and more than 6000 photos). A little expensive than its competitors but i prefer canon over the other brands. Feels a little slow at times, but that might be coz my memory card is old and has a low writing speed. Has excellent manual functions for the novice photographer. Not worth buying now as S100 is available for a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: Goog pictures, but defective after 1 month
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: The camera takes great pictures, professional quality. 1 month after buying however, the flash stopped working, it doesn't pop up out of the camera. The display says that there's a malfunction and I should turn it off and back on again, but it doesn't fix it...

Reviews.Title: Canon S95
Reviews.Author: Tamaz
Reviews.Content: Made in Japan. That's all I can tell. Everything on its place. High built quality. Great price for such product. Thanks to Amazon

Reviews.Title: Awsome little camera!
Reviews.Author: K. Ketell
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures.  Fantastic performance in low-light conditions.After reading all of the complaints that the lens sometimes got stuck because it was opened in a pocket or purse I purchase the Canon PowerShot PSC-900 Deluxe Leather Compact Digital Camera Case (Black) and wore the camera on my belt for a week while on vaction without incident.

Reviews.Title: Stellar Camera, Stellar Value
Reviews.Author: Dutton Peabody, Editor "C D Mann"
Reviews.Content: I shoot some of Canon's best gear professionally and this is my pocket camera.  It's an outstanding performer and is the best value out there.  You can buy a better point and shoot, such as the Fuji x-100 (for $1000) but nothing comes close this side of $500.

Reviews.Title: Wide Angle is NOT Wide Angle, but I still love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Ernest F. Carneau "EFC"
Reviews.Content: In my quest for the perfect point & shoot for me, I purchased the S95. I also own the Sony HX5v, the Sony HX9v, and the Canon S80.I had the Canon SX210, which I loved except, sold it because the video was weaker (not HD)than I wanted it to be.My problem with the S95 is that it really does not have a good wide angle. I know the spec's say it does a 28mm, but it does not do a good wide angle and does not even perform like the S80 in wide angle.I take my camera's out with me and take pictures. I wanted to take a couple of pictures of a Nissan dealership in Washington the other day, and the S95 was unable to get the complete bldg in the picture, or even half of the bldg., as did the HX5v and the S80. Am I going to sell the S95?,  No, I love this camera. The size, the picture quality, and the performance is great except for that issue. The video (HD)is not the best in the lot, but it's in the running, and plenty good enough for when I have it out.I really think that most of the complaints on point & shoots are from not knowing how to work the camera's though. Wide angle on the S95 is not a user issue though.For the money, the size, the performance, I would never get rid of the S95, unless I could only have one camera, which is not the case. The S95 runs close with the Panasonic LX5 in pic quality, except that the panasonic probably does wide angle just fine.  I've never been able to play with the panasonic. Other camera's of interest would be the Olympus XZ1 and the Nikon Coolpix P300. But they're alot bigger than the S95. I could easily own the canon SX230, which is the SX210 with HD video and GPS. The S95's wide angle problem is the only thing I can think of that I can really fault it for.

Reviews.Title: Probably the best camera ever!
Reviews.Author: zebratechreviews
Reviews.Content: Well, the camera that I have had for about 5 years just kicked the bucket on me, and I knew that I had to get a new one for my family. After a few days of browsing around online, I came across the Canon PowerShot S95. One of my photographer friends had the PowerShot S90, and I had heard nothing but good things about it so I did a little bit of research about the newer model. It turns out that there were tons of.... Read the rest of the review here: [...]

Reviews.Title: Hot Pixels
Reviews.Author: Christopher Chin-sang
Reviews.Content: I want to start off by saying I'm a hardcore canon user, over the years I've gotten 3 dslr's from them, a bunch of lenses, and I've bought P&S;'s as gifts and recommended them highly.  But I must say I'm a little disappointed with the quality control.  I received this camera with a pixel stuck on in the center of the frame.  Right in the middle of every photo theres a blue spot no matter what.  At this price point for a point and shoot I'm disappointed to be having issues right out of the box and normally I would write it off as an anomaly but I did my research and a lot of people have the same issue and either returned the cams or had to have them warrantied.  At least I can easily return it as defective but what a hassle.  Canon is slipping on the quality control so make sure if you decide to buy one to thoroughly inspect it.  Otherwise pretty good features for a point and shoot, but too expensive to be having quality control issues.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for 369$
Reviews.Author: J. A. Benjumea
Reviews.Content: I cannot say more than other reviewers. This is a great camera in a small package. Very good low-light performance. Ideal for hanging out at night. The retail price is 399. Do not pay more than that as I have seen some other stores selling it at 499.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Darth Abraham
Reviews.Content: This is easily the best digital camera I've ever used. It's dead simple and takes great shots every time.I'm far from a professional photographer and this thing more that meets all of my needs. It's small enough to fit in my front pocket and it provides enough versatility to work in basically every scenario. It takes the best low-light photos I've ever been able to shoot. It even has settings that I think are kind of silly, but still super fun to play with - Minature effect, color replacement, fisheye, etc.If you're looking for a compact, convenient point-and-shoot, look no further. This is the one to get.

Reviews.Title: Small and compact without giving up too much quality
Reviews.Author: C. Gahagan
Reviews.Content: Sold as Canon's "pro" point and shoot, the S95 is a slight upgrade to the S90.  If I owned the S90, I would likely skip the upgrade, but since that wasn't the case, here I am.  The upgrades over the S90 are notable and include a better click ring on the back and upgraded texture, like the 7D, on the body.  I expected better low light capability out of an f2 lens, but it is a P&S; camera.  Size and feature are the big selling points for this camera.For the one-bag traveler, this camera is hard to beat.  Small, compact, great daylight photos, decent low-light abilities, and decent battery life.  Throw a 16GB SD card in it and you could shoot thousands of photos without the need to offload them to a computer.  I wish it had a GPS and still better low light capabilities, but for the size, it's hard to beat.If you're looking for a better than average P&S; to travel with and ultra-light, one-bag travel is your thing, this might be your answer.

Reviews.Title: love the camera!
Reviews.Author: camera fan
Reviews.Content: The only feature that I did not like about this camera is its lack of zoom, otherwise it is an amazing camera that takes high quality photos.

Reviews.Title: Better than the S90 but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Azza
Reviews.Content: I purchased the S95 after owning the Canon S90.Pros- Great size and very good photos (compared to regular points and shoots)- Built in flash- Big LCD screen- Lots of manual controls (but I don't use them much)Cons- Still a little pricey- Usability still needs some work- Some videos aren't in focus if the subject matter is too small, and recording of sounds is ok (not great)- Finger can get in the way of the pop up flash- Is a little slow to shoot- Cheap wrist strap - it's just a fancy piece of string with no way to tighten itI don't use many of the manual controls so I'd actually prefer a regular/cheaper point and shoot with brilliant sensors.The S95 is a definite improvement upon the S90 in the following areas.- Much grippier - the S90 was slippery because of the glossy surface while the S95 is a matte finish. This makes a huge difference- Better differentiation between buttons (on/off and ring control) by changing the shape- HD videoOverall, if you have spare cash I'd get it but would still consider the Lumix LX5

Reviews.Title: Buy a $400 cam for more!
Reviews.Author: Tekon
Reviews.Content: Great low light performance camera with bright lens.With some improvement over the S90.I found a deal for $369 so it was totally worth it.But I can't see any reason to pay over the brand new sales price($400)I guess some people thinks that price gouging is fair.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good.
Reviews.Author: J. Waugh
Reviews.Content: So far I like it and it is just what I was looking for; compact, reasonable feature set, easy to use.  Just not pleased with the popup flash, because I normally have my left forefinger there... but I am adjusting to it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Ogul
Reviews.Content: These are really good cameras to pick up used.  They were the best around in their day and still compete very well with the newer crop of cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, can do anything, controls small for large fingers
Reviews.Author: Paraducks "Gioco"
Reviews.Content: My headline says most of it. It's a very versatile tool, very flexible and has great capabilities but the small buttons and somewhat un-intuitive menu can be difficult to operate.  It's wonderful to have with you as a pocket camera but if the "auto" setting isn't what you want, it may be difficult to get it to the settings you want. They are there just sometimes difficult to find and sometimes physically difficult to choose because of the small buttons. I wouldn't complain about the buttons if size forced them to be as small as they are but it does not. Despite my negatives, it is a great camera and, four years on,  I am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Survived a massive explosion
Reviews.Author: M. rogers
Reviews.Content: I was shooting video with this camera from a large tripod and there was an industrial accident followed by an large explosion. The camera was struck head-on with flying debris from the explosion. The debris was about a 30-40 pound item that became a flying projectile from several hundred feet away. The camera initially gave me the classic 'lens error.' When I got it home and attached it via HDMI to my TV, it powered down and has worked fine since then. I have to say, I truly didn't expect a camera like this to survive that kind of abuse. Didn't even scratch it.

Reviews.Title: Mine Was a Lemon
Reviews.Author: MN Swede
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for the PowerShot S95, based on the rave reviews for it's predecessor, the PowerShot S90. I ordered the S95 to replace a Canon PowerShot SD940. The S95 is a really nice looking little camera, with lots of creative features...more that just a "point and shoot." I was excited to have a camera that was so small and easy to carry around, and that took high-quality images. I also purchased a Canon PSC-900 leather case to protect it when it was in my jacket pocket. But when I looked closely at the first images that I took, they just didn't seem very good. They were sharp in some spots, but out of focus in other areas. I looked through the owner's manual, and tried different settings, but no improvement.Too late to return to Amazon, so I sent it to Canon under warranty. The turn-around was amazingly fast. I had it back in about a week. The bad news though, was that the images were even worse than before. Sent back to Canon a second time, with same fast turn-around! This time, they got it right. The images were finally razor-sharp throughout the entire image. What a sweet little camera! My favorite to slip in my pocket when going out and doing stuff with family or friends.Fast forward about 18 months. Took the S95 to a family brunch get-together a few weeks ago. Took the camera out, turned it on, and nothing! Only the current time displayed in jumbo numbers on the back screen, with each number inside a square, and the squares would rotate as the time advanced. If I pressed the shutter button, the lens would suddenly pop out, and the image from the lens would appear on the screen. But none of the buttons worked, so no way to pull-up the menu or change settings. The zoom and auto focus worked, and if I press the shutter button it takes a picture, but again, only at the settings that are "frozen" since I can't get into the menu to change anything. No flash either. Basically now worthless as a camera. (But a cool desk clock!)What a let-down. The camera was kept in it's case since day-one, and looks like brand-new. It's never been dropped or wet or near a sandy beach or salty ocean air. Only took 1497 shots with it. Not worth paying $100+ to have it fixed, especially based on it's track record, as it would probably fail again.BTW, I gave my old PowerShot SD940 to my daughter in college, and it is still working flawlessly after almost 4 years and 1000's of shots...I should have stayed with that one!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Sam Randol
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It has served me quite well for a very long time.  I dropped it once and broke the lens, but was able to have it repaired quite easily.  Takes wonderful clear pictures, especially since I'm not all that steady.  Great all around camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little cam!
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I bought this one to compliment my othe S95. The picture is great and is excellent in low light. I'm shooting video for YouTube and these fit my needs perfectly

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Foofienugget
Reviews.Content: I hike a lot, and this camera is ALMOST as good as a full on dslr in most instances.  Obviously, it isn't going to handle telephoto, macro, wide angle stuff well but if you are looking for a pocket camera, this is the one to get.

Reviews.Title: Great P&S;
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Broadhurst Jr.
Reviews.Content: The S95 is a great camera for taking photos of people and anytime indoors.I use a DSLR camera for landscape, wildlife and sports photography, but in other situations where a P&S; is convenient, you can't get a better camera than the S95.

Reviews.Title: very happy
Reviews.Author: Chris L Stewart exp
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the service here...The product was as advertised, and when there was an error with a periferal, it was looked after promptly.

Reviews.Title: My friend who is a professional photographer recommended this to me
Reviews.Author: LeeSkiJr
Reviews.Content: It was well beyond my skill set, but after 3 years of owning it I grew into it.  I love this camera. It is the best P&S; with the options of the larger cameras.For those complaining about shutter speed, this is a setting that you can change.  Visit the following url.  [...]Thank goodness for these types of sites, it really helps you to see all that this camera has to offer, especially if you are novice.

Reviews.Title: Pic quality
Reviews.Author: 70 and holding "Wopper"
Reviews.Content: For the price, this camera takes beautiful pictures. Prints made from it are clear. It will fit into a shirt pocket or a lady's purse easily and can be used in a moment's notice. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who would like a nice camera at a cheap price.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, specially in low light conditions
Reviews.Author: Khaled A. Aldhahri "Khaled"
Reviews.Content: I got the S95 and so far I really like it, the quality fit and finish is very good, and has new features .

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: William Petersen
Reviews.Content: Pictures are much better than cameras that cost twice as much.  Terrific size.  Fits in most jean pockets, easy to have everywhere we go.

Reviews.Title: Amazing little camera
Reviews.Author: deepsoul13 "deepsoul13"
Reviews.Content: To avoid discrimination against my full-body DSLR and lens when I went to museums and popular places on a trip, I bought this little camera. It allowed me to shoot everything in RAW, and had a very fast write speed (though I bought a SanDisk Extreme SD card). The images were amazing. The live-view editing of manual settings is also incredibly accurate to what actually comes out of the camera. It's like a compact, mirrorless Rebel xsi.

Reviews.Title: Slick . . . but slow?
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife as an upgrade for an old Fujifilm F31d that she loved. Like many Canon products, it seemed very well thought out and well executed, but it was slow, and she just never got used to it. Don't know if we got a lemon, but it just seemed to lag when focusing and firing the shutter, and when you've got a small, active child (or pet), it can get frustrating when you keep missing those "cute" moments.Too bad, because it can certainly create some beautiful photos, and it has a ton of features and capabilities. Makes me wonder whether we got a lemon. We replaced it with another Fujifilm (the XF1, which isn't perfect but focuses quickly and that she really likes).

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: i7 iMac
Reviews.Content: This camera is a true gem, the video and photo capability are truly impressive.The RAW capability, and surprising amount of controls for both video and photos are really fantastic. Being able to control the exposure for video, and being able to control the f power of the flash is truly great!Love it!

Reviews.Title: Three years and still going strong
Reviews.Author: Gasp!
Reviews.Content: This will be nearly three years I've had this camera, and it's still going strong. It is more versatile and better quality than my cell phone camera. It easily fits in a pocket.It's been dropped once or twice and continues to work, it's got a good battery life, a good flash, and good sensor. If the newer model is anything like this, it's a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Alice Lakin
Reviews.Content: Easy to operate and fantastic quality.  Great for rapid picture taking.  I loved my daughter's, so bought one exactly like hers,

Reviews.Title: great photos, compact size
Reviews.Author: Renee Elsdon
Reviews.Content: Lots of great features and it takes great shots. I bought this camera to bring in lieu of my SLR for instances when I didn't want to lug around the SLR or risk damaging it (like multi-pitch rock climbing routes). This camera has made me very happy. It can hang off my harness or daypack and be used single-handedly. It takes great pictures. I love the manual features. The multi-shot timer mode leads to fun summit photos. My only complaint is that the shutter speed is so slow compared to my Nikon SLR

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Internal Conquest
Reviews.Content: and i miss it dearly.  I wish I never left this camera in a rental during a business trip.  I took this camera everywhere with me and never had any glitchy problems with the programming or the lens.  I'd gladly buy this camera in the future if the price ever goes back down.

Reviews.Title: Good Image quality, easy to carry around
Reviews.Author: K J Mughal
Reviews.Content: Used it for 2 years! Great camera for general use. Excellent results in low light without flash. Never used it in manual mode.

Reviews.Title: Great quality pictures and easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Caitlin
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Light weight, easy to carry, takes beautiful pictures! I use it mostly for up close food pictures but it works well in any situation. Would recommend this for a starting out photographer!

Reviews.Title: Worth buying
Reviews.Author: niki
Reviews.Content: I was using this camera all the time since I got it. Good performance at low light. Easy to carry.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: fountained
Reviews.Content: Love this little compact camera. Still using today because it takes great pictures. Easy to use, and it's small, so my husband can carry it in his pocket.

Reviews.Title: malfunctioned after 14th month
Reviews.Author: R. Navarro
Reviews.Content: took great photos, light easy to use, needed a handle from franic, and extra battery but malfunctioned after 14 month.

Reviews.Title: You'll be happy you got it.
Reviews.Author: Hydrated and Happy
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera. The picture quality is amazing. I really like the zoom in feature on the lens. I think this is camera is better than some SLR cameras. But what do I know.

Reviews.Title: Great camera...excellent performer and very compact
Reviews.Author: G. Farnsworth
Reviews.Content: This has been a solid performer.  I bought this for my wife and got the G12 for myself.  We ended up using this one way more because it is so much more compact...so much more likely to be taken with you.  The picture quality was about the same....this one just has fewer features.  The pictures are great and the videos are phenomenal when there is plenty of light around.  Good solid high-end compact point-and-shoot.The only issue I have with it is that if you start a video before this focuses it will stay out of focus the whole time. Not sure why.  Oh also sometimes it will start up and say the battery needs replacing even if the battery is brand new.  If you go to view pictures instead the message goes away and then you can half-press the shutter and it will work just fine.  Looks like the detection of battery level when you start it up is buggy.  Luckily my workaround solves the issue at the expense of a few seconds.Edit: my wife dropped this in the dirt and since then the focusing has been very, very hit or miss.  Now I need to decide what I'm going to replace this with...or should I have it fixed?

Reviews.Title: My favorite handheld camera
Reviews.Author: Roxanne Kelley
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera with a lot of feature that make taking pictures fun. The quality was as high if not better than my slr at times.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Mcpharlin
Reviews.Content: I wanted a high quality point and shoot camera that was easy to carry around and has lots of features.  I'm no photographic expert, but in my experience, this is an excellent camera.  It does everything I need it to do and probably several things I haven't figured out how to do as well.  It's small size makes it a breeze to carry on my pants belt in the leather case I got with it.  The case was made for it, so it fits perfectly.  The pictures are sharp with great color.  The video capabilities are all I could ever need.  The camera feels good in my hands.  If I were to quibble about anything, it is that I had to learn to keep my left index finger off the top of the camera where the flash pops up in situations that need the flash.  I'm not so old that I couldn't learn to do that.  My wife got the Canon S100 (the next version in the Canon PowerShot series) a few months after I got my S95.  My camera savvy is too limited for me to see any improvement in the newer version.  Unless there are some significant advancements in the PowerShot series, I will be sticking with my S95.

Reviews.Title: Perfect.
Reviews.Author: tito
Reviews.Content: Perfect camera for it's size.Very nice screen quality.However it is a semiprofessional camera, Picture quality is much more better than a professional cameras of other brands.

Reviews.Title: Fine pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Alan M. Birnbaum "Alan Birnbaum"
Reviews.Content: No longer available.  Canon in this series is now up to the 5X S120, which likely should show some subtle image quality improvement.

Reviews.Title: My son is enjoying it!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Dallas
Reviews.Content: I got this as as a gift to my son; as far as I know,l he's enjoying it!  I'll have toi tell him to give you his camera a good rating!

Reviews.Title: Stands the test of time
Reviews.Author: RampagingRook
Reviews.Content: Haven't been in the camera market since I got this a few years ago, and I think that speaks to the quality of the S95, and what I perceive to be diminishing returns in the field of digital cameras.Other than the occasionally surprising pop up flash, sometimes questionable auto settings in medium light conditions, and inherent limitations of a sensor this size, there's really not much to improve on.

Reviews.Title: pocketsize G12
Reviews.Author: Michael Kim
Reviews.Content: This offers full manual flexibility of G12 and performance, plus portability of Ixus series. Slim and light design, bright lcd, an superb picture quality, this is a great backup snap for your existing DSLR force and reliable main for short trips.

Reviews.Title: Great every day camera
Reviews.Author: Sauna
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera if you want a camera for every day photos. The photos come out very clear and the zoom is fantastic.  It has lasted a few years and I have no complaints and see no reason to replace it.

Reviews.Title: power shot s95
Reviews.Author: Richard R.
Reviews.Content: I'm enjoying it even more than I thought I would.  Easy to carry, easy to use, great design.  Just right.

Reviews.Title: Good stuff comes in small
Reviews.Author: Sim
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for sth small that you can carry around with you and take pictures anytime you want without all the gadgets, this camera is for you.I am not a professional photographer, yet I often received compliments from my friends who are photographers said that the picture I took using this camera is fantastic.Well, pictures could sometimes turned out not the way you want, but you can always get online to fix your pic :)

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Mondoray12
Reviews.Content: In the 3 years that I've owned this camera it has always produced excellent photos. Postcard quality! Sharp! If this camera were a knife it'd cut high-carbon steel like butter. And it's very easy to operate. A true Phd camera. [push here dummy]. Just set it to the defaults when you first get it and everything you shoot will be excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: E John Agnew
Reviews.Content: Just about all the features of the g12 but in a package I don't mind take back packing, or anywhere I don't want the bulk. Takes longer to access certain features to set up particular shots because you have to go through menus, but its all there. Gotta study and practice though, 'cause it is easy to forget how to get to some settings and you lose shots that way.

Reviews.Title: Best pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Margaret R.
Reviews.Content: User can change exposure by turning a ring. ...not by going to a menu.User can set auto-focus area for center or random.Large view screen.Camera fits in this lady's pants pocket.Small battery fits well in other pocket.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: Rafi "M&M;"
Reviews.Content: I like to log my SLR and lenses with their own case everywhere I expect I need to take photos.  Many times, they are just too heavy for the occasion, so the S95 comes to play.  The results are extremely good for a point and shoot and the controls are customizable enough to get great photos.  Being so small, the controls are sometimes finicky, but that is what you get for miniaturizing.  Some times, the colours are a bit off, especially in low or unusual light.  Maybe I should cary a grey card with me at all times.  The beauty is that both my wife and I enjoy using it.  Keep in mind that I am a fair amateur photographer who puts thought into his pictures and my wife would not be able to zoom into frame to save her life. Just a perfect little camera for everyone with great balance.

Reviews.Title: Happy with purchase
Reviews.Author: Elijah
Reviews.Content: Even with its age, this Canon S95 camera with its 2.0 CCD lens is simply brilliance in a small form factor!!!!

Reviews.Title: A fine camera for its size
Reviews.Author: David D. Mcnerney
Reviews.Content: I replaced my Nikon D90 DSLR with this, after tiring of the weight and bulk of that camera and the 18-200 lens I usually used. This one is very portable and takes fine pictures, but the pictures are just not the same as the ones that the DSLR took (imagine that ...). The difference became especially noticeable once I got a Retina MacBook Pro.I'll keep this as a highly portable backup camera for now, and soon I'll buy another, lighter DSLR for my main travel shooting.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: chef michael
Reviews.Content: Takes beautiful pictures, easy to operate, small enough to carry everywhere.  Wish I were a better photographer, but this camera will make me one.

Reviews.Title: Canon S95
Reviews.Author: Pete H
Reviews.Content: I had previously owned an S95 but it was stolen.  Consequently, I knew what i wanted and was looking for a competitive price.  I was very pleased with the condition of the used camera I purchased and it arrived quickly without incident.

Reviews.Title: THE ONLY CAMERA YOU NEED
Reviews.Author: Mara Kurtz "MK"
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic camera, everything you need in one little lightweight body.It's fast, sharp, and has automatic, semi-automatic and manual modes.As a professional photographer I've owned everything from Leicas and Nikons to 4x5 and 8x10 Deardorffs.Unless you have special requirements, such as shooting wide-angle vistas, this camera is perfect.The only camera you need.

Reviews.Title: powershot S95
Reviews.Author: Donna EBS
Reviews.Content: I find this camera to be so awesome I gave it 5 starsI  It shoots great pictures, very clear, good color.  Lots of good options and just easy to use and carry around with me.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera.
Reviews.Author: novanaut
Reviews.Content: I am by no means a photo buff, so I can only review this as someone who wanted a great point and shoot I could take anywhere. I have used this camera for a few years and really love it. There are so many great features and the video isn't too bad too. It is relatively small and I can take it everywhere. The picture quality is wonderful and I especially like the low-light settings. I would recommend this for anyone who wants to take professional looking photos without paying a hefty price or having too much experience!

Reviews.Title: Best point & shoot we've had !
Reviews.Author: Nils Westholm
Reviews.Content: Actually bypassed buying the newer models for this one. The first one we had met an untimely end having to do with too many daquiris and a swimming pool. We have found this point and shoot to be extremely effective in low light for both video and still photography. The audio is actually pretty good too. We use this to shoot at music concerts and it has often matched or surpassed what we've seen captured by much more sophisticated and expensive cameras. The battery life is outstanding. I've shot full 2 hour concerts without changing batteries.

Reviews.Title: Good image quality
Reviews.Author: Buck Hodges
Reviews.Content: For such a small camera, it produces very good quality images. It also supports shooting in RAW, which is great since that allows for adjust things like the white balance, exposure, recovering highlights, etc. I bought it for my wife a year ago, and she's been very happy with it. Previously, I had a Canon G7 that we used (I now use a Canon 60D almost all the time).

Reviews.Title: very pocketable
Reviews.Author: castor
Reviews.Content: it is a very pocketable camera but with the freedom to adjust setting for any ligth condition as amateur photographer.

Reviews.Title: Three years later...
Reviews.Author: B. Jacob "restless reader"
Reviews.Content: I have dropped this a few times, my toddler has played with it a few times, and this still takes the best pictures of any point and shoot I've used (and those that I see my friends post online).  I am a hobbyist and own a Nikon D80 and know a *little* about manual operations which has helped, but even the AUTO mode takes fantastic pictures.Features I especially like:1. Vivid colors in good lighting.2. Great pictures in dim lighting (very, very hard to find)3. Lots of modes, including fireworks, beach, snow, etc, for people who don't want to fiddle too much.Note: I have not yet tried the S100 or other models, but if you are wondering if this is a good camera on it's own, then do not fear-- it's awesome!

Reviews.Title: Gift for my wife
Reviews.Author: Patrick McCabe
Reviews.Content: Wife loves her camera! Very many prosOnly a couple of cons, hence the 4 star rating.1. Rechargeable battery only - can't just run into a store and buy a couple of AA batteries if power runs low.  Suggest buying an extra rechargable to have on hand and charged.2. Flash pops up when needed and tends to interfere with properly holding the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: josh
Reviews.Content: We have had it since Nov 2011. The auto mode works ok. We used it at first but we seemed to be getting a lot of blurry pictures or pictures that were too dark. We switched to the P mode and have made some adjustments to get the quality of pictures that we prefer. We also did some research to understand how to adjust the ISO. It has been a learning experience but overall we like this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love the picture quality, flash compartment has failed twice.
Reviews.Author: ScroogyDoo
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazing pictures. Very good low-light pictures. In fact, in low light situations I can see much better in the viewfinder than with the naked eye.I have used this camera on numerous trips and it's taken some of the best pictures of my friends and family.The flash compartment is the only disappointment. It has failed twice and I had to send it back to Canon to have fixed.Also when you hand your camera to someone to take a picture of you, the fact that the flash pops up is a constant surprise and tends to startle some folks, resulting in poor pictures.

Reviews.Title: NEVER LEAVE HOME WITHOUT IT
Reviews.Author: Battosai2k7
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and always keep it nearby.  Crystal clear pics and vids with great battery-life.  Get amazing shots from a camera about the size of a wallet.  Great investment.  Definitely one of he best point and shoot cameras around.

Reviews.Title: Canon S95 - A Good Camera
Reviews.Author: John D VanBuskirk
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a two year old Nikon.  The Canon has better autofocus and optics and produces better images even at the same resolution.

Reviews.Title: Best photos with flash
Reviews.Author: Brandia Deatherage
Reviews.Content: I tried several different small digital cameras in this price range, and this was the only one that didn't cast an absurd unnatural shine on people's faces when using the flash.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: SiChips
Reviews.Content: Definitely the best low light point and shoot camera I've used.  The zoom is not that high, but you've got to trade off features.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Rozanne Paxman
Reviews.Content: I read about this camera on a photography review website, consulted the Amazon reviews, and bought it. I bought a case for it so that when I carry it in my purse, it won't get damaged. I love how light it is. I've been known to stick it in my jeans pocket and carry it around with me. The lens isn't as fast as a SLR, though, and I've missed some shots of my fast-moving grandkids because of it.Over all, I'm very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: antoine
Reviews.Content: i bought this for my wife as a wedding present and it has documented the first years of our marriage:trips, life, everything. it is compact, has great battery life and is the best camera i have ever used.i would buy it again in a jiffy or maybe upgrade to the latest model in the line from canon.it's not a dslr but it's the best camera to have in your backpack or purse at all times.so you can always count on it.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera, but it broke
Reviews.Author: sburd
Reviews.Content: Let me just start by saying that I love this camera.  It is exactly what I was looking for in a point and shoot camera.  I am a mom with two small children, and I wanted a camera that takes great pictures, but doesn't have the bulk of a DSLR camera as I am constantly on the move and am already carrying way too much.  I am just starting to get into photography so it allows me to gradually go into more of the manual modes.  The reason I am giving this camera a 3 star review is that unfortunately after 6 months of use, I got the dreaded "Lens Error message".  Apparently this is the only error message that the camera will give you, so it doesn't mean that there is a specific defect that one can ascertain when receiving this message.  At least that is what the tech for Canon told me.  Just know that it means you can't fix it by yourself.  The positive is that the people at Canon were amazing!  I called the customer service line, and they immediately gave me the information I needed.  They asked for my address and told me where the closest center for canon was to send my camera in and have it fixed. I received the camera back in approximately 10 days.  It works great once again.  I was still covered under warranty, and I would have been so mad if it had happened 6 month from now. I'm crossing my fingers that everything is okay now.  Again love, love, love the camera, but disappointed that it broke so quickly, and I promise I took extremely good care of it!

Reviews.Title: Tiny, but amazing
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a camera to travel with as I don't always want to lug my DSLR around with me. This is the perfect size for my purse, and it shoots in RAW!! What more could you want?!

Reviews.Title: I have nothing to say, except, excellent digital camera.
Reviews.Author: Joseph, Jecho and joshua houston texas
Reviews.Content: I got this camera last thanksgiving cyber monday online thru amazon. The delivery was quick, and tried the camera immediately after recharging. Got flowers in the vase,  without flash, the camera gave me amazing pictures. What an excellent camera for a price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome value for money
Reviews.Author: Real Fakename
Reviews.Content: I bought it item when it was on sale and it awesome. The only thing i would change in it is the pop up flask which always gets in the way while i am holding the camera.Low light image quality is good. I havn't got a very steady hand but i am still able to click awesome picture with it. With my previous camera my photos always used to come out shaky.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: DRasulev
Reviews.Content: I own it for more than a year now and take it with me everywhere I can - travel, business trips etc. Very good picture quality, amazing number of different modes but most of all I like that it shoots in RAW. Great addition to your DSLR if you travel a lot :)

Reviews.Title: Best P&S; Camera Ever!  Get one before they disappear.
Reviews.Author: Tracey Su "Tracey"
Reviews.Content: I bought an S95 for myself but my electronics-and-technology-fearing Mother loved using it so much that I bought another one for her.  I might get a third one for my Father.The photo colors are acceptable.  Canon cameras seem to have the best color accuracy of all the brands.  Mother seems satisfied with the flower color accuracy of the photos.  I love this camera because it seems to find light where there is no light, even in Auto mode.  The manual functions are also awesome for a little P&S.;The only limitation of this camera is the 4X optical zoom but for me, it's a small tradeoff to be able to take such fantastic low-light photos.  I also disabled the flash.A Lowepro Tahoe 30 was purchased as the case for this camera.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: Anh H. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Excellent point-and-shoot camera. Compact, and the images are crystal clear.  I also have its competitor, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-LX5.  I find that I use this Canon S95 way more often when on the go, and tend to leave the Lumix at home.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, professional quality
Reviews.Author: kristinanndavidson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera last year and couldn't be happier with it.  I have all my photos on [...].  This camera really takes great, professional quality pictures!  Check them out and let me know what you think!

Reviews.Title: The best point and shoot camera ever.
Reviews.Author: Monu Koshy "Monu Koshy"
Reviews.Content: Look no further.. S95 is the best point and shoot camera produced till date. Its better than the newer S100 and S110 Cannon line up. Extremly happy with this purchase. Recommended to two of my other friends who instantly brought it, and love them as well.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful little camera.
Reviews.Author: Frequent Amazon Shopper
Reviews.Content: We've been all happy with our S90 but we decided to buy this one after we bought the underwater case.  We are now even happier with S95's 720p video.  The lens is not particularly bright on long end but we still think the camera deserves 5 stars.I won't go to the tech details.  In general, both S90/S95 are our backup camera when we don't want to or can't bring our larger ones.  The cameras serve our purpose very well.  The image quality is good enough to us for normal viewing and better than those standard point-n-shoot cameras.  The color balance is very good for our taste.  The low light image is acceptable for online viewing.  The customizable front ring is really a wonderful design.  And it is small enough to go with us everywhere.More from S95 are the slightly increased burst rate, raw files and 720p video.  We are not video people but the 720p video from S95 is really a bonus.For sure there are better alternatives for a high-end point-n-shoot but S90/S95 do give us what we expect.

Reviews.Title: Just got the item
Reviews.Author: Rushabh Shah
Reviews.Content: Love it. So far its been just 2 weeks but the camera is taking nice pictures. I have old Canon and this upgrade is worth.One thing I dont like is the file size of the picture. But in this age of terabytes, this is not a big deal anymore.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera - Nice Seller
Reviews.Author: TroyBoy
Reviews.Content: Needed a point-and-shoot camera capable of good clear pictures for inclusion in test reports when hand-held in a variety of lighting conditions, and with very short focal lengths.  Not a photo enthusiast - just want consistently good pictures as simply as possible.  So far camera fits the bill, don't need to reshoot as we did with previous camera.  Should also mention excellent experience with seller Big Value.  Camera arrived before was scheduled, and they offered to provide memory card when I asked for refund when wanted to return as card wasn't included.  Apparently nearly all cameras don't ship with them.  Can't use the camera without them - go figure.  As Amazon's (new?) shipping service Premiere is not consistently reliable at getting Prime orders delivered on time, will consider others like BigValue that are lower cost but are not Prime.

Reviews.Title: My favorite camera
Reviews.Author: ZMomUtah
Reviews.Content: I love this camera more than I can express. What amazing pictures it takes!!! I use it more than my big fancy digital SLR. Canon has great picture quality, and this camera is no exception. I have not had any quirks or problems with it at all, even taking it to Brazil and South Africa within 4 month of purchasing it. It is unbeatable for the size and the price. My only complaint is that it is hard to get a good hold of, because of the small and square nature of the design. I just bought a Richard Franiec custom grip, and it has solved the problem. Totally worth it for this camera. It's portable and easy to use. Amazing, amazing, amazing.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: JAZ
Reviews.Content: The pictures I have taken with this camera are awsome, color balance, sharpness, lights, everything is just perfect.  I recommend it 100 percent to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot camera so far
Reviews.Author: pmaa
Reviews.Content: This camera is simply awesome. Good job Cannon. The only thing I would have liked is if there was a Bulb Mode. As it is the camera can only have the shutter open for at most 15s.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: BNM22
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for girlfriend and it works fantastic! The only issue I have is with the pop up flash, which can be annoying when you have random people taking pics with it.

Reviews.Title: Great lil' cam..
Reviews.Author: Gary Friedman
Reviews.Content: It's a great lil' camera to replace my Canon S90, which my wife stole from me. I guess this will do the job, when I finally get round to reading the online manual. Great lil' cam. [ASIN:B003ZSHNGS Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera with 3.8x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD]!

Reviews.Title: 10 stars all the WAY!
Reviews.Author: Green Roses "Crown Antiques"
Reviews.Content: After using Canon A series this is the best camera you can by! I researched what all the Canon series meant and watched several videos on YouTube about this camera. After learning just a little how to use it...I have great, perfect photos even better than my daughter's Nikon expensive camera. GREAT for taking Ebay or photos to sell online. I could not be happier.

Reviews.Title: In love with my Camera!
Reviews.Author: dpeace
Reviews.Content: I researched endlessly until I finally picked the Canon S95. I am soooooo happy with my choice. It's Week 2, and although I haven't had the time to explore all the features this camera brings, I am extremely extremely pleased with its picture quality and the feel of the camera. :) Very happy with this purchase. No regrets.

Reviews.Title: i like it very much
Reviews.Author: peach
Reviews.Content: it's very easy to operation.and the picture color is beautiful. everyday i bring it,so i can take picture when i want to record the scene.

Reviews.Title: Excellent pcs. I am very happy with this product and would like to recommended to everyone to buy.
Reviews.Author: Raj Kattel
Reviews.Content: Excellent pcs. I am very happy with this product and would like to recommended to everyone to buy. I am using everywhere where ever I needed.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Photog4fun
Reviews.Content: This little camera takes wonderful sharp photos and is a great asset to my DSLR when I don't want to lug my big camera around

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Avid reader "Avid reader"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera to replace my Canon Power Shot SX200. Wanted both automatic and manual controls, and this camera is one of the few small cameras that has these features.

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot
Reviews.Author: John Castillo
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my girlfriend for x-Mas and she absolutely loves it. Stop messing with Lower quality cameras and get this one. The reviews here are pretty accurate. Great images!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: irulz
Reviews.Content: Got this camera during lightning deal, probably the best purchase ever.Its very compact and image quality is fantastic.Probably the best low light camera performance (P&S;)Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: WalterWhiteBB
Reviews.Content: This camera takes better pictures than most of my other point-and-shoots. Images are comparable to the SLR snaps that I have taken. Only thing is that, the flash goes up where I keep my left hand on the camera. So I am learning to hold it differently :-)

Reviews.Title: little camera - great picture
Reviews.Author: Bud
Reviews.Content: I have a Rebel T2i that I love but needed something smaller for convenience sake now & then.  I'm very happy with the camera, mostly b/c of the small size and great picture value.

Reviews.Title: Canon S95 outperforms all previous point & shoot predecessors
Reviews.Author: voooduchild
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I needed a point and shoot camera with higher capabilities than others I have purchased before.  I needed a P & S camera with digital SLR capabilities.  I was really tired of coming back with almost great pictures of the event one second after the dream shot could have happened.  I was not disappointed.  This camera catches action photos and moving subjects quickly enough to get the shot!!! No more, hey could you folks who just scored the winning goal, would you mind getting together and faking a shot so I can actually capture it on my terribly slow point & shoot camera?  Hallelujah!!!!  Praise the lord.  Amen.

Reviews.Title: swewet camera and great price
Reviews.Author: Kurt H.
Reviews.Content: purchased for my daughter for a Christmas gift since a DSLR would be too much for her.  I am happy that the results are great. Wish I bought two for the price offered. A sweet purchase.

Reviews.Author: Hannah de las Alas
Reviews.Content: i was debating between buying this camera or a nikon p300. all my cameras in the past have been canon and i wanted to try somethin new but couldnt. so i finally made the decision to purchase this camera. i love this camera. it takes photos jus as well as a DSLR. it so compact that it fits in every purse. i havent had the time to really explore all the features the camera has. But i can say that i did not make the wrong choice in decidin to buy this camera. next product to buy is a the case for this camera.. any suggestions???

Reviews.Title: upgraded from the s90
Reviews.Author: Darren
Reviews.Content: many improvements but the s100 seems to be even better. In this model, they removed a little notch for your finger which helped to be able to hold the camera. In the s100 it is back! aha! Otherwise, the camera is great. So happy with these. I bought one for myself and my wife. Now we have two point and shoots. I thought one was enough, but two is much better. According to all reviews I've ready by professional photographers, and blogs of professional photographers about their gear, THIS is the best point and shoot camera for the size and price. It has AMAZING low-light shooting capability without flash, which is one of the most important things we love about it. The quality of the shoots is awesome. And it is very small. This camera is awesome and when people ask me about cameras and I compare this to the ones they ask about, I always come back to this one as being the best, in my opinion. Others like more zoom and are willing to trade off for size and f-stops, while others want a lower price and are willing to trade off on f-stops. That's fine. But if you know what I'm talking about, you'll know that this is the best camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for myself and I love it. It was complicated at first but after a little reading its fine. It takes wonderful pictures and I would defiantly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot I've owned
Reviews.Author: K. Petersen "Book Mom"
Reviews.Content: I have learned that not all Cannon PowerShot cameras are the same.  This one is the best I've owned!  I highly recommend this camera as one of the best before moving to the SRL level of camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little point and shoot
Reviews.Author: W. Gruber
Reviews.Content: I originally bought this camera for my wife.We took it on a trip and since then I'm using it most of the time.It's auto setting works very well, but if you know how to use a slightly advanced camera then this is perfect for you. The picture quality has been fantastic, very clear and colorful.I'm not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: hayiluya2009
Reviews.Content: Very neat product! It is very small to be put into any pockets of pants. But the most important part is that the pictures it takes is really awesome! I brought it to Orlando Disney and Took lots of great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Canon S95 Camera
Reviews.Author: Goraw
Reviews.Content: Takes very good pictures. Handy and easy to use. This camera is comparable to the more expensive ones. It is the best small camera I have seen. Over all I am happy for getting it. My wife loves taking pictures and has her own gear but now she wants to take over this one.

Reviews.Title: S95 Great Camera at a great price!
Reviews.Author: Gray
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on a recommendation from family. It was quickly shipped and received, as promised. We took it to NY for the Christmas holiday and took over 400 excellent pics. It is simple to use (easy enough to wrangle 3 small kids at the same time) and the picture quality is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera with 3.8x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD
Reviews.Author: nab
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good, light, compact camera, and I finally found it.  I love the wide-angle capability.  The pictures are clear and crisp!

Reviews.Title: Tiny camera, big results
Reviews.Author: Amanda Rebbert "Mandy R. nebulite"
Reviews.Content: I'm liking this camera so far. Lots of options for a more advanced photog, but easy enough to 'point and shoot.' Very small, easy to use. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: yc
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with this camera. It's small and performs beautifully. I bought it as a gift for my mother but I love playing with it when I get my hands on it. Great everyday camera. Ships immediately. Only regret was purchasing it for $289 as now I've seen it as low as $229, and Amazon does not do price adjustments.

Reviews.Title: Perfect pocket camera for the experienced photographer
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: I have Nikon and Pentax DLSRs, so I was looking for a camera that would allow me to have some of the same features, but still have an auto mode for quick shots.  This is the camera!  I like that the camera's texture makes it easy to hold, but also easy to pocket.  There is not rubber or other material to catch on fabric.  Glides in/out easily, but has a good grip.  To quickly come up to speed on the camera's functionality, check out Alexander White's excellent S95 book.

Reviews.Title: Very good picture resolution , decent performance
Reviews.Author: Kallol
Reviews.Content: First thing, I like the speed. It takes 1 sec to snap and ready for next shutter. Picture resolution and color is very good, you can crop any portion and it is usable . The only annoying thing is the macro distance. Since it can not focus less than 2 inch(some other camera can reach 1/2 inch), you may not get the satisfied result while capturing tiny objects. Other than that it is an excellent point and shoot camera. For best result, try manual mode keeping the ISO at 80... Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: sbr
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small pocket size camera that I could carry always with me and take pictures of my kid anywhere. This camera is exactly what I was looking for. I love the sleek design and the fast electronics. Most importantly, the quality of the pictures is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect camera
Reviews.Author: gallup
Reviews.Content: I purchased a S100 at first, but soon I started to realize that the image quality of S100 was not even close to the S95 owned by my friend. So I returned my S100 and bought this S95 instead. So far I have used it to take over 1000 images. The image quality is SO IMPRESSIVE!!! I really love this compact camera!!!The only drawback that I can think of is that S95 has a wide-angle of 28mm, which is not as good as S100's 24mm. And it did make a difference. But this is not major. I would hope Canon develop a S105 or some sort of product with impressive image quality delivery as S95 does and the 24mm wide-angle.

Reviews.Title: Everything you could ask for in a Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Carlo Pastelero
Reviews.Content: Great Value. Fantastic Picture quality. Very user friendly. Lightweight and handy vs other high-end digicams. Screen shows crisp, colorful photos. You can't go wrong with this. Only issue (and this is nitpicking) is the flash that pops out - I was hoping it could've somehow been built into the camera body already.

Reviews.Title: Bad Mutha
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Moved to Seoul ROK for my job, beautiful city, but it was hard to get good photos at night with a compact camera. Spent a month researching online and found that the Canon S95 appeared to be at the top of the food chain. It has not disappointed. Would buy again in a heartbeat and would recommend it to friends and family. Can not stress enough, if your looking for a great compact, this is it. And at this price...they wanted $600 for it at a Canon store downtown and I wouldn't have felt ripped off if I had paid it.*bonus* I really like the kind of gunmetal feel of it.

Reviews.Title: I love my s95
Reviews.Author: mike bach
Reviews.Content: This is far and away the best point and shoot I've ever owned. It's the perfect pocket camera for the photo geek who doesn't want to lug his DSLR everywhere he goes, and it's so easy to use that even my mom can take great shots effortlessly with it. The miniature mode (tilt-shift) never ceases to amuse.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: MRE "MRE"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera!  It takes low light shots that are extremely good, even in auto-mode where you might not expect it.  It is great for the tourist, as it fits in a pants pocket without being too bulky.  I cannot complain about anything, and I see that the price is starting to come down ($30 less than when I bought it 2 months ago), so I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: dlearyous
Reviews.Content: the canon s95 is a fantastic camera.  gives all the manual controls of a larger camera in a compact size.  takes amazingly sharp pictures.  i use it for diving and have already got fantastic results.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot S95
Reviews.Author: Utah
Reviews.Content: Our camera gets lots of use and this is the second Power Shot we have bought.  The first one was a PowerShot SD750 which I still use today.  (I added the review for my 750 so you know that Canon has some great cameras at differnt price points. This camera has a great macro setting that I tend to use often.) The S95 has optical zoom and so you pay more for the camera but this feature is awesome!  You can see ducks in a pond in the distance and zoom in as if they were only a few feet in front of you.  I am not a camera expert I just love to take lots of photos so I cannot review all the features of this camera but it does what I want it to do and love this camera.  I usually have it set on the automatic feature and it takes great photos all by itself.

Reviews.Title: The World's Best Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I previously owned a Canon SD1400IS which is a great camera and phenomenally sleek and compact, but I am still glad I upgraded to the S95, especially before I went to the U2 concert.  I see why Ken Rockwell calls this "The World's Best Pocket Camera."  I especially like to shoot raw.  Now that I use ACR and CS5, I will never be able to go back to JPEG.  I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Its a Super Pseudo SLR.
Reviews.Author: Matsumoto
Reviews.Content: Great Stuff. All I have to say, is that canon should just eliminate most of the auto functions such as the various scenes like underwater, low light, tilt shift etc and just leave the Full manual control along with the auto focus. That's the main reason I bought this camera. If you want an auto function camera, then gets something else, there's a ton of them for a lot less. Besides that, No complain here. Its like a SLR without the zoom and the size. I never use the auto features, except the auto focus. If you want HDR Photos, all you need is a tripod and Photomatrix. The HDR auto function on this camera is a joke. It reduces the image to a 2.5MB JPEG file and it only takes three shots in different exposure which is very limiting. I only use the manual setting with the auto focus, auto tracking, focus lock, and occasionally, the AI servo feature. 10MPix is more than enough for prints, the 28mm lens is not so much a problem, because I always runs my photos through Photoshop before making a print and photo-stitch along with lens correction sometimes fixes the wide angle issue. And as you know, Photoshop can recreate all the auto scene effects that are produced with this camera and I see no reason to load it in because I never made a direct print from camera to printer without doing some photo corrections.Besides having the auto mode, its not a loss and still remains a top notch slim down camera with an SLR power.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for its size and price
Reviews.Author: MattA
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I bought it refurbished, and it was like new. Has all the manual controls and a few very nice features. Fits into my pocket, yet takes great pictures. Looks like it's especially famous for the low-light pictures it takes. I also like the fact that it can be set to snap a picture when the subject smiles :)  I am yet to find any significant flaws to its design.MBA

Reviews.Title: Love this little thing
Reviews.Author: J. Harrington
Reviews.Content: I have been on a few trips abroad with my Olympus E-510.  Lugging a DSLR around can be a pain.  I bought the S95 just before another trip last fall and took both with me.  I found the manual controls easy to work with.  I never shoot flash so I was amazed at the low light photos.  I did have to send it back under warrantee at one point but it has been going strong ever since and I am not taking any stars away for that issue.  The last trip I left the E-510 at home and didn't miss the weight or bulk and I don't feel I missed any photo ops as a result.  Each camera has its place, the S95 I can carry every day and it is not a bother.

Reviews.Title: Cannon S95
Reviews.Author: Bernice
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with the sharpness of the photos and am amazed at the features offered. The experience in using this camera so far is wonderful because the results are impressive and really encourages me to shoot more. I am still experimenting with light and distance, flowers and distance shots have been amazing. . Learning the S95 potential is definitely a work in progress .

Reviews.Title: great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Lola O.
Reviews.Content: This camera's low profile helps keep it from getting broken, which is a nice extra benefit.  It consistently takes nice pictures also.  It's a little larger than the normal Powershot range, but it shoots RAW and has a very fast lens for a point and shooter. Image quality is excellent, and the camera features a full range of settings, which can be at times, a bit confusing. Focus seems to be a bit of an issue, but once you become accustomed to the camera, it gets easier to get perfectly focused shots. The lens control ring is an interesting addition to this camera, and quite functional. Great camera overall - you will This is a nice update from Canon. It's much smaller than the G series, with many of the same features, and is a big move up from the normal Powershot line. The camera has GREAT low-light capability, and is durable and solid.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Clint Jones
Reviews.Content: I am a semi-pro photographer and normally shoot a DSLR. However, I wanted a "pro" point and shoot for vacations. This camera has all the manual controls that one needs. It also shoots in RAW, which is a huge plus. The quality is the best I've seen in this type of camera. My only complaint is that the battery life is rather short. Do yourself a favor and order an extra battery with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect pocket camera! I bring this S95 everywhere
Reviews.Author: Chris L. W.
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for several months and I always love it!Pros:+small size (This is a huge advantage. I put its case on my belt everywhere I go. The small size that make it the best camera for me.)+picture quality (open the link on the bottom to see pictures taken with S95)+manual control (I can learn tricks with this small camera.)Cons:-battery life (I have one non-original battery as my primary. I keep the original battery as my backup.)If you want to know cool images taken by this camera, check this out:[...]I used "Case Logic TBC-302" for its case. Here is my review regarding the case:

Reviews.Title: Right for my needs.
Reviews.Author: Rich Hayhurst "Photography lov'r"
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for my needs, and experienced photog who wants more control over the image than most Powershots offer.  It is probably overkill for someone who is not interested in the flexibility that it provides, but as a mini unit to substitute for my 5d MII, it will do just fine.  That said, of course it does not deliver images anywhere near to the 5D, but it will fit in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Oleg S
Reviews.Content: This is the camera i fall back on when i do not with to bring my SLR.  Images come clean and sharp, and the night/indoor party pictures are perfect.

Reviews.Title: Canon S95
Reviews.Author: SL47
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Current state-of-the-art compact camera.Cons: I was surprised to find out that Apple's Aperture (I use this program all the time) does not support the S95 raw files.  It does support the S90 raw, so I assume that it will be corrected soon.

Reviews.Title: "lens error" day 3 on trip to Mexico
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Jenkins "berlyjen"
Reviews.Content: So heart breaking. I got to use the S95 for 3 days before the dreaded "lens error" message appeared.It toke some great photos during that time but...it will not open now. Traveling in Mexico with no point and shoot.My first and last Canon I will ever buy.

Reviews.Title: My S95  only lasted 5 months
Reviews.Author: Eric T.
Reviews.Content: Small controls, sometimes mode selector got switched inadvertently. Good performance in low light.After 5 months of satisfactory operation the lens would only extend part way because of some mechanical problem. I sent the camera back for repair, now Canon says they have no record of the camera.$380 down the drain.I will never buy another Canon product ever again.

Reviews.Title: A worthy companion to a dslr such as the canon 5d Mark II
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This review is intended to help someone decide whether to buy a s95, not to decide between buying a 5d or a s95.  Clearly these are very different products, but the s95, or other cameras like it, can potentially provide a useful secondary camera for someone not wanting to lug a 5d and its lenses around all day long.I own a 5d Mark II and a number of L lenses, and was looking for a secondary camera, especially one that was portable, yet offered high image quality.  My challenge is that i'm very picky on image quality, and my initial inclination was that I'd suck it up and continue to use the 5d if I could not get reasonable quality from the s95 or a similar product.  I know the image quality will be vastly different, but the question is whether all things considered (portability, image quality, etc.), would I be happy using the s95 as a backup, or would it severely disappoint me.I took the plunge and bought a S95.  In short, I'm happy, but not ecstatic.  Obviously, there's a big difference in image quality, but its not as big as I expected.  If used in the right conditions (good lighting, artificial or otherwise) with a low ISO setting (400 and under), you'll be very happy with the results.  It may not be appropriate for poster size, but would work well up to 8X10.Video - it does shoot video, and perhaps HD according to some measures.  However, the quality is so so.  This is in comparison with my companion Canon Vixia S100.  Again, unfair to the S95 to make this comparison, but footage is very noisy.  All else seems fine, but the noise is unavoidably there.  Also, unlike conventional camcorders, the S95 does not continuously auto focus on the subject; you have to be very careful to ensure your subject stays within the focus plane.General - if you're a dSLR user, you would buy this camera as a easily portable option.  The size is great, it easily fits in a pant pocket, and you certainly don't experience fatigue by carrying it all day, as you clearly do with a 5d.  You definitely will not see 5d-like image quality, but you will produce extremely usable shots.  Someone once said the best shots are the ones you actually get.  I take that insight to heart, and find myself capturing many more images with this than my 5d simply because its easy to do so.  My 5d is glorious, but the s95 is always there ready to do.Again, my point was to determine whether I could live with the s95 as a backup to my 5d, not to replace my 5d.  Given the pretty decent image quality and superb portability, the answer is yes.Also, i'm rating this a 4/5.  It would be higher if the video quality were stronger.  Irrespective of any comparison to an equally priced or higher product, the video definitely lags.  Its nice for impromptu footage, but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error - Died after four days of use
Reviews.Author: David Levine
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera to take on my honeymoon.  I got some great pictures during the four days that it worked.  Then it suddenly froze up with a "lens error."  Unfortunately, amazon's 30-day return window had expired by the time I returned from my honeymoon, so I'll have to ship it off to Canon customer service for a warranty repair and hope for the best.

Reviews.Title: Lense Error
Reviews.Author: Cj
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for maybe 3 years now-- About 8 months ago I started getting a 'lens error' message all the time and ended up having to send it in for a repair at cannon. That cost me about $150 but I figured since I got 2ish years out of it at the time (and I treat this camera like a baby. No drops, no beach trips, i mean hey- it was expensive so I took GOOD care of it)I'd pay the price and hopefully get another 2 years out of it. Nope, 6 months after its "repair" it did it again, conveniently AFTER the repair warranty. Huge bummer and lesson learned I suppose. So, now it also has a hard time focusing, so forget about turning it on and capturing a quick photo of my 2 year old. I turn it on and its all blurry, unable to focus. Then i have to turn it off, restart it, try again (if the moment hasn't passed). Some days I turn it on and just get a 'lens error', most of the time the lens error will correct itself when i restart it but I know this camera is on its way out. So between the lens error reading and the fact that its unable to focus most times, its a huge pain and unreliable now for our vacations and stuff like that. And im not paying for a 2nd repair. So I'm basically hanging on till it dies and then that's that. For the money AND the cost of the repair I would have expected it to last longer. I love cannon, and while it took great pictures/videos for the time it DID work, this experience has left me with a sour taste and that's the reason for the 1 star. To bad they wont fix it, and offer a recall on it or something since SO many people have had this issue!

Reviews.Title: What's the big deal!
Reviews.Author: Henry E. Derres
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews on this camera I bought one. Disappointed. Having many used digital cameras for ten years I was expecting something great. I try it out indoors. A purple chair becomes bright blue when the walls are white. The color becomes correct only when that is the only color you can see. Oh I have to adjust the white ballance. Now I've got a purple chair with amber walls. I currently use a Panasonic FZ35 no adjustment necessary. Outside an amber object on the edge of the picture becomes yellow and is only correct when it is centered. I've tried to monkey with the different controls but the colors are never right. As a side issue the cd will not load on my windows 7. Great even five year old used camera cds will load.

Reviews.Title: A small problem
Reviews.Author: KaoXiaoJie
Reviews.Content: The camera is awesome, but be careful when you buy it from QUALITYPHOTO.The S95 they are selling is a gray market good and so you will get a chinese outlet plug for your charger. Other than that, the camera is awesome and is made in Japan. So in other words the camera is legit.

Reviews.Title: Best compact bar none but fragile
Reviews.Author: Edgar Betancourt "HD Lover"
Reviews.Content: I am a diehard Nikon photo enthusiast, but to my chagrin Nikon has not produced a compact camera to rival this little wonder. This little camera takes pictures that are almost SLR quality. Low light performance is excellent as are focusing speed and accuracy. It also has almost instant startup and almost no shutter delay, it even has a usable 2 FPS frame rate! Although it has an almost SLR like menu of options and adjustable parameters including full manual mode, etc, this are really more for show since the camera's small form factor and controls make it difficult to run it in modes other than full auto and the preset scene modes. That said, its amazing that they are available at all and they work well! Its zooming range is small but the lens works very well throught its range. It has none of the terrible pincushioning and chromatic aberrations of long zoom compact cameras. Even the video mode is well executed and tkes very good 720p video! In its default settings it does try to make up for its inherent limitations by producing slighty oversaturated colors, however, this is easily corrected in the color settings. Its main shortcommings are associated to ergonomics, its simply a small box, thus it doesnt have any real handgrip, its buttons are tiny, and the controls for adjusting its comprehensive manual parameters are the barrel and the small rear control rings making them unconventional and a little hard to use. Also caveat emptor: the camera is fragile while the lens is open. Our daughter "killed" hers when she dropped it onto a hard surface. All in all, the proof is in the pudding, this its a very small form factor camera that takes excellent pictures even in low light conditions and suffers from none of the usual performnce compromises of compact cameras, it even offers the option of creative photography if you are willing to mess around with its small controls. Only more expensive digital SLRs produce consistently better quality photography and that is probably only noticeable to the critical eye. For a 400 dollar, snapshot size, take anywhere camera, that is high praise indeed. Nikon should be taking notes :)PS: I like it so much I even bought the excellent, full function underwater case for our trip to the caribbean!An update on an otherwise great camera. The S series has proven quite fragile in my expirience. My original S90 died after a drop of around 4 feet onto a fiberglass surface. Our S95 developed battery door issues so it stopped working. Great pictures for the size but FRAGILE.

Reviews.Title: What a great camera
Reviews.Author: GAI Gohari
Reviews.Content: I've been using the s95 for over 2 years and I'm thrilled about it .It has great options,effects ad features. It's small and pocket size.clean design and light.Lets get to the point : the shots are crisp and look great . Colors come out awesome and the camera really captures light and situations greatly.Now I'm no great photographer at all but this little guy takes great Candids and portraits.I bought this camera twice and id recommend it to anybody looking for a quality camera at an awesome value.

Reviews.Title: Awesome pictures!
Reviews.Author: Carrie - Texas
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about a month now, and I love the way the pictures are turning out.  The lighting was always a problem for me with my other camera, but this one has handled the lighting in our house and our church very well.  I am so impressed!  Also, there are so many features.  I cannot wait to try all the different options.  One more thing, I have been able to take "blury free" pictures of my 6 month old!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot S95
Reviews.Author: Marija Valentekovich
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because it has very good rating and is very easy to use it, My husband has one and this is second one in our household.

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Goram
Reviews.Content: Canon S95 is the best point and shoot camera out there in market. Ironically, it's even better than its upgrade S100. The camera is higher priced than most others, but it's definately a worth buy.

Reviews.Title: perfect camera
Reviews.Author: Anne
Reviews.Content: Perfect quality of pictures! I bought it when Amazon has a deal. I spend $250. Even in the dark room, it can take very good pictures. plus it has small size and beautiful appearance. Love it!

Reviews.Title: BIg SLR's  are now obsolete for non-professionals
Reviews.Author: S. Griffin
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier with this camera.  I wanted a high end camera that could do it all--outdoor acitivites, family photos, travel photos and slip in my pocket.  I have been an avid slide film photographer in the past, so I liked the idea of the user friendly manual controls,especially the ring around the lens which  is either shutter, aperture or focal length depending on which mode you are in.  But honestly, the auto mode is so smart and tells you which mode you are in (portrait, landscape etc) as well as what you are focused on, I've not even bothered to use the manual modes yet.Where it really excels is indoor.
