If you have decent lighting, the lens/sensor can handle it without a flash.I almost made the mistake of getting a full sized SLR--small cameras have finally achieved the quality acceptable to just about anyone but those who do it for a living.

Reviews.Title: SLR in a pocket!
Reviews.Author: f.kwan
Reviews.Content: Everything written about this camera is true:  it's the best low light photography pocket camera in existence.  I took an accidental shot of my dog in Program mode at ISO 1600 and it had very little noise and wonderful shadow detail.  The fine tuning white balance was better than my Pentax K1000D, which is mouldering in a vault because I can't stand to carry it around. :(  The manual control ring, short cut button and Custom modes are a necessity.Beautiful shallow depth of field even outdoors in rainy light (ISO 80, 1/13 sec, f/4.5).  I did a straight shot of some trees and the near branches were out of focus while the far trees were dead on.  I had to contort myself with the macro feature in my A710 to get a similar effect.The bad news:  HORRIBLE battery life.  I don't like proprietary batteries to begin with.  I actually wished the thing were a bit bigger, say the size of my old A710, which this is replacing because the latter's lens finally cracked, to maybe accommodate enough AAs to power it, but oh well.  I think I got 80 pictures out of it before the battery died.  If I hadn't a spare I would have been in a bad way.  Will have to get another spare one.The other bad news:  continuous focus is slower than molasses and blurs every third shot.  I haven't tried the focus tracking yet.I'd like to see more flexibility as to what can be displayed on the screen.  I had to go with a basic vanilla empty version because it had too much information on it for me to see.  The live histogram is nice.I'm too poor to upgrade to Photoshop CS5, 6 whatever it is now, so I had to use the Canon software to process the RAW files. It's actually fairly good but crashes intermittently.  I did convert the RAW files to DNGs with the Adobe DNG converter to save.  I wish the Canon software had a DNG option instead of disk space gobbling TIFFs.I was also impressed with the icontrast (increase shadow detail) feature.  A lazy bum could get away with using icontrast on JPEGs in lieu of processing RAW in certain instances.  The screen is much more contrasty than reality and highlights which look blown on the screen may not be so bad.Don't leave home without it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: For the price and features, I don't know of a better camera.  Low light is the best I have ever seen on any pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Cjwhittington
Reviews.Content: for the size and weight, there's nothing better with this picture quality. My only contention is when the flash is up, there is less room to hold the camera.

Reviews.Title: I
Reviews.Author: Veronica
Reviews.Content: This is my second Cannon, I bought this one as a backup for my Rebel xTi which is great but too big to carry around everywhere. I was surprised at the clarity and quality of the pictures and the features that comes with it.It's pretty much awesome.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera -
Reviews.Author: Jill
Reviews.Content: I recently ordered this as a father's day gift for my husband because we were looking to upgrade from the Canon Elph we bought a couple of years ago.  This one is just as easy to use, but with better image and stability.  We are not professionals so I bought one of the guide books to go with it, along with the extra memory card and case.  I'm very happy with the purchase and glad I bought it here on Amazon - no sales tax and shipped very quickly (I have Prime).  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly Happy
Reviews.Author: bave98
Reviews.Content: Purchased the PowerShot S95 for a trip abroad.  Size is perfect, fits in a pocket.  Shtter speed is quick making it easy to take great shots.  Picture quality is terrific, zoom enables close shots.  I'm able to get really high quality shots with only a basic use of the camera's features, and with a bit more time believe this camera will be a perfect match for my needs.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: A. Chaudhari "Anj8326"
Reviews.Content: This is the most amazing camera ever! I havent scratched the surface of all its capabilities but I love it already!!

Reviews.Title: excellent little camera
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife, as she's not keen on carrying my 5D Mark II around.We're very happy with this camera.- Fast focus and trigger.- Very well built. Feels like a little rock in your hand.- Quality of pictures is quite good.

Reviews.Title: love this handy little camera
Reviews.Author: avery
Reviews.Content: i love the camera, it's a great compact size can fit it into my purse so it's readlily available to take photos... it takes great pictures and has lots of options for being more creative or just snapping photos...

Reviews.Title: Perfect if you love your DSLR
Reviews.Author: R. Sander
Reviews.Content: If you want all your DSLR controls in your digi cam, this is the camera.  Shoots in low light, f2.0, IS, super intuitive mechanical type controls, its just perfect.

Reviews.Title: Terrific for one year...
Reviews.Author: Timothy McCarthy
Reviews.Content: This camera is an ideal point and shoot camera... for about one year in my case.. From reports on the web, it appears there are problems with the display, like mine, which developed a black dead circle the size of a dime...

Reviews.Title: Cheaper Plastic Construction Compared to Previous Powershots
Reviews.Author: J. Stahl "millvalleyj"
Reviews.Content: I've owned a couple different Powershots over the years.  I keep upgrading to newer, better models.  This one's body is plastic.  It looks and feels cheaper.  And it is more fragile to stick in your pocket.I liked the photos this took.  But after a couple months, the back of the body started to peel away (so you could see the screen from the top of the camera through a little crack where the frame around the glass screen was no longer tight to the body).And then the lens opened and would not shut.  I had to force it shut, and now I have a broken camera with a lens error.For the price I paid, this is so not cool.

Reviews.Title: All I can say is WOW
Reviews.Author: M. Field "Drew"
Reviews.Content: In the past 6 months I have bought (and returned) three different pocket cameras...all disapointing.  I didnt hold out a lot of hope for the Canon S95 and thought I might have to go up to a camera that wasnt so compact. I already have a Nikon D300 so I really didnt want to do that. Boy, was I surprised!the S95 is like having a mini DSLR in my pocket.  The pictures are beautiful, the controls very easy to use (didnt even really need a manual) and it fits in my pocket.  Good job canon, you got this one right.The ONLY drawback I have found is that while it does shoot in Raw mode the Raw file is not supported by Photoshop (yet),  also couldnt convert it to a DNG file :(  Adobe will eventually fit that though and I knew this before I bought the camera, so can't blame Canon for that one.Buy this camera, you wont be sorry!

Reviews.Title: Excellent portable high quality camera - but exposure can not be changed in Auto mode
Reviews.Author: namikawa
Reviews.Content: Excellent little camera and extremely portable. Makes excellent pictures. Has almost the same features as the G12. Takes very good pictures at low light. Auto mode works very well. Also takes very good underwater pictures when combined with the Canon underwater case. My only complaint is that you can not modify exposure settings when in auto mode. You can do that on other Canons. So if you need to change exposure (sometimes Auto mode does not get it right) you need to go in P mode where you have all the options of a high quality camera.

Reviews.Title: Best picture quality I've ever had.
Reviews.Author: jason
Reviews.Content: I've never owned a dslr camera, so this review is relative to my other experiences with point and shoot cameras.  Despite the physical look of the camera, which is quite boring, the picture quality for this camera is simply the best I've ever seen.  It was good in low light settings with and w/out flash and great in all other types of lighting.This is the first camera I owned where people are in awe of the picture quality.  I know at least 5 people decided to buy the canon s95 after they saw the pics I took.My only complaint about this camera is the lack of a touch screen which seems like a standard feature in a lot of cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, well worth it.
Reviews.Author: JB90
Reviews.Content: Everything about the camera is great. It really does pay to spend a little more for this camera to get amazing picture quality. Would recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: Compact camera with all the options
Reviews.Author: W. Kroger
Reviews.Content: I purchesed this as it had all the adjustments on a compact camera that included aperture priority and shutter priority mode. In auto mode the pictures are going to look like pretty much like any other cannon compact camera. However, I can get better shots in AV (aperture priority) mode down to F2 and was able to make adjustments for bad lighting situations when setting up family photos on a tripod. It also has a low light mode that is way better than the auto flash compact cams but can still be hit or miss. It also has a nice little selection of scene modes. I haven't be able to try out all but like the HDR and panoramic options. The picture speed is quick in no flash and a bit faster than my old cannon elf with flash. I purchased a 15mb/s SD card and writing speed doesn't seem to be much of an issue except with HDR.Adjustments are the best they can be for a small camera and it takes a little bit to get used to not putting your finger where the flash is. Exposure is always easy to adjust and useful. The documentation of the camera outlines the features but will not help you select based on situation.I was going to initially purchase an SLR but needed something smaller and figured that since this camera had all the manual adjustments I may not need an SLR. I like the camera and would purchase it again due to it's compactness and photo quality and adjustments. However, it does not take the place of an SLR as my friends photos always come out better and fast in SLR auto mode.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: love2auction
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for a business and our company just loves it.  It is easy to use with excellent picture quality.  The low light setting makes a huge difference in our pictures.  I plan on purchasing one for myself personally.

Reviews.Title: Basic UI issues
Reviews.Author: Dean Collins
Reviews.Content: I'm at best a point and shoot photographer, and i've only owned my new Canon S95 10 Mega Pixel camera for 1 month or so but here are my initial thoughts.Minor peeve;- the shoot button isn't where you think it would be, it should be located where the focus rocker switch is.- the flash pops up right where your fingers are, should be moved.Major peeves;- the photos can only be sequentially named, there is no option to name the photos taken with date and time which is the way my old Fuji had as an option (and my preferred way of naming files)- the photos can only be exported to a local drive, for whatever reason in their wisdom Canon have decided to not allow the software to write to network dives which is just silly.Apart from that getting some really nice images, the colours and images seem to be super rich even in point and shoot mode and like i said i'm not expert but these seem pretty basic peeves that would have been found with the most basic of user testing.Cheers,Dean

Reviews.Title: Great Camera-Don't get ripped off
Reviews.Author: D. Launderville
Reviews.Content: Great Camera-just upgraded from the S90. WARNING do NOT get RIPPED off. This camera lists for $399. It is just out and is easily available if you look at Best Buy or other retail outfits  or wait a week for Amazon to restock. MSRP is $399 NOT the $499 some THIEVES are trying to sucker you into paying.

Reviews.Title: S95 - best of the field of high-end point and shoots
Reviews.Author: David Henderson "David"
Reviews.Content: I'm a Canon fan and love my S90 for it's small size, ability to capture terrific images and RAW format. I shoot everything in RAW. Canon's S95 is the latest generation but is not a quantum improvement over the S90, as I had hoped for. For one thing, the viewable image on the screen is slightly smaller than the S90 even those the glass screens are the same size. I compared the S95 against the Lumix LX5, Leica D-Lux5 (same camera as the Lumix LX5), Nikon P7000 and Olympus XZ1 and found the Canon S95 to be, without a doubt, best in the field.

Reviews.Title: Canon S95
Reviews.Author: piquekid
Reviews.Content: I have one of these camera's already but it's well used,loved and well worn out. I had bought the newer version of essentially of this camera. It felt cheaper in my hand. I didn't like it near as well as this older version.It fits in a pocket easily. When you are being a tourist you can get better shots sometimes because no-one pays much mind to someone with a little camera.

Reviews.Title: Not CMOS but works
Reviews.Author: B. Renken "Photographer"
Reviews.Content: The S95 works ok.  It is not like a DSLR but the pictures are great for the price, quality, and size of the camera.  I just wish it had a CMOS sensor.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Rox
Reviews.Content: The camera is exactly what I expected.  I had purchased 1 before at Best Buy, and it was stolen in a home burglary.  It was the perfect camera for me.  Beautiful pictures and extras -- like the vivid picture mode.  I am very pleased with my purchase, and have used it ever since receiving it.

Reviews.Title: Not a Reliable Camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher W. Hansen
Reviews.Content: I wanted to upgrade my Olympus weather proof camera to something more professional and with better manual control. I had been very happy with the Minox 35 EL and ML and was hoping for something similar. While the Canon S95 seemed to fit the bill, some wedding photos I took were disappointing, especially at full zoom. The focus wasn't very crisp despite the image stabilization.  The inventory pictures I took after Hurricane Sandy were very good, but I suddenly got the infamous Canon S95 lens error restart message. So much for carrying the camera in a case in my front jeans pocket. I think an inherent flaw in the design is the motorized zoom lens assembly. The Minox lens came out manually when you opened the lens cover and the Olympus was all internal movement protected by the water resistant design.If you like this kind of camera and don't want to be disappointed then you better buy two models to use one as a backup when the primary fails. That makes the price prohibitive and complicates carrying the cameras. You could use your cell phone as a backup, but then why buy this camera in the first place? Even with a damaged, partially blacked out LCD screen the Olympus keeps working. I never babied it like the Canon, but didn't deliberately abuse it either. I'm debating whether to fix this, but at $150 to Canon and with other small digital cameras available it doesn't seem worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara J. Votrobeck "babsvo"
Reviews.Content: This is working great for me.  It takes great photos and is easy to download onto my computer.  It's a winner.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: mtaakers
Reviews.Content: Only have had it a few days, and not yet learned all we need to know about it.  The basic functions and results are very nice so far.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Zamboni411
Reviews.Content: I brought this camera for my wife to keep in her purse.  So far so good!  She wanted something small and easy to use

Reviews.Title: Easily the best "pocket" point and shoot camera around!
Reviews.Author: Tom Nirider
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Canon S95 after seeing it recommended on Ken Rockwell's website.  Ken is absolutely correct, what could be better than a pocket sized point and shoot camera with manual control capability?  And, the images are simply wonderful, limited only by the small sensor size.  Simple to use, accurate exposures, what more can I say?  Great product, I'll bet the replacement S100 is even better.

Reviews.Title: Raw is the key to this camera!
Reviews.Author: Adri L.
Reviews.Content: Your best camera is the one you have with you, but....  I can't say I'm blown away by the Canon S95 point/shoot, but the RAW aspect really makes a difference, especially in the noise. I got it for a steal at $239 one day Amazon deal (new S100 is out).PROS It gives you more control than most and RAW capture is essential. Portable.  Video much better than S90.CON It's not a DSLR... just doesn't come close.  Pop up flash can get in the way.  Color saturation a little too cool.  Video not as good as S100.In the end, at least you'll be able to fix it (I couldn't with my other .jpg PnS) and you got the shot.

Reviews.Title: been eying this camera for a while
Reviews.Author: R. Chang
Reviews.Content: I got the Panasonic DMC-LX2 a couple of months before it was discontinued.... then Canon came out with the S90.... I loved the LX2... but really was chagrined that I didn't wait just a bit longer... anyhow, flash forward 4 years, and the S95 has been replaced by the S100... now I swoop and got the S95 on discount -- it's a great pocket sized camera that can shoot in RAW!  It's pretty fast and can handle low light settings pretty well (especially if you underexpose then process in post...) -- I'm a big fan, have had the camera for a couple of weeks now and the images are great!  If you shoot raw basically you have to shoot in the 3:4 ratio, while I missed the 16:9 of my old point and shoot, it's size and ease has make it my carry around camera.  Definitely better (and faster to shoot) than my iPhone 4 camera as well...

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: carlos aguilar
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small camera and was considering buying the g12. I'm very pleased I chose this baby wow what great shots. Cant go wrong

Reviews.Title: New Camera
Reviews.Author: PapaDoc
Reviews.Content: I have had several less sophisticated Cannon Power Shot cameras in the past.  Upgraded to the S95 model and like the features of increased clarity, wide angle and the stabilized zoom features.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for a back yard photographer
Reviews.Author: Babbette Jablonski
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  The biggest curve is the rechargeable battery.  I was used to throwing a couple AA's intro my old Canon.  But the battery has held the charge nicely with my usage rate.  There are features yet to be discovered.  The ease of use, transferring to my 'puter, and the quality of photos--I was way over due for a new point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Buy it!
Reviews.Author: A. Frank "Adamizer"
Reviews.Content: I have been using the camera for about 7 months now and the overall feel and quality of the camera is superb. All the controls are straight forward and easy to use. The buttons are easy to see and are solid to the touch. The control dial on the backside of the camera is enjoyable to use as well. The battery life is good enough for plenty of pictures and a decent amount of video. If you charge the battery only when it needs it, it should last a while. As of right now, this camera is awesome and is working fine. It feels so solid in your hands and really takes amazing photos. Huge assortment of customizable options to choose from to tweek pictures. Definitely a buy!And for all the "lens error" problems, i really dont see that happening unless some serious damage is done to the lens itself.

Reviews.Title: The Best Point and Shoot Camera to date!
Reviews.Author: Apiwat Ratanamangcla
Reviews.Content: I bought the Canon S95 as a sidekick for my Canon 5D mk 2.  Good IQ, of course not as good as the 5D Mk 2, but the best I've seen for such a small sensor.Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Worth to buy
Reviews.Author: Tao
Reviews.Content: I select this product after comparing with other camera. and it does not make me disappoinment.  The only shortcoming is the battery time not long, so you maybe need a back up.

Reviews.Title: Canon S95 ROCK!!
Reviews.Author: Cuong
Reviews.Content: there's plenty of information and review on here already so im just going to say AWESOME! and leave it at that for now...

Reviews.Title: It seemed too good to be true
Reviews.Author: Stephen Selph
Reviews.Content: I have been waiting for this camera for several months and the anticipation was more than I could handle waiting for it to come in the mail. The picture quality is amazing and everyone knows that, that is not why I am here to review this little guy. Video is one main selling points for me as I like to shoot when interesting things happen around me when I am never expecting it. The portability and the HD video seemed like this camera would be a match made in heaven for me. But, the video issues ended up being the deal breakers for me. I knew of the problems before purchasing the S95, but I did not realize how much of an issue it was. I have several older P&S; models that can AF and optically zoom while shooting, why can't Canon figure this out? It's almost like that just want to save something for next year's model so people will have reason toupgrade.Also the macro is not on par with even budget P&Ss;, I have to be at least 5cm away to focus in on very small objects. This seems like a minor gripe, but I love to shoot macro. I have taken hundreds of photos with this camera and I just cannot get as close as I would like.So I kept looking around for other options and I think the LX5 has all of the things that I have complaints with from the S95, so I purchased it and it should be here in a couple days right before I leave for the Bahamas. I will do extensive testing comparing both models for my needs. I really am in love with the portability of the S95 and I see myself taking it out more and getting greater photo ops than I would with my larger cameras. I know that the LX5 is $100 more expensive, but when already dropping $40, another $100 isn't going to make a huge difference over the few years I plan on owning it.I will update when I get back from vacation and make my decision on which camera has won me over.

Reviews.Title: No Brainer Camers
Reviews.Author: Jerry W. Barrow Jr. "jerbar70"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I wanted a camera that I can just point and shoot and get quality pictures without the fuss of settings, and I got just that.The camera is so easy to use that I find myself taking random pictures just so I can use it and see the quality of the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Big disappointment
Reviews.Author: kevin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera thinking it would produce noticeably better quality images than my 4 year old Canon SD-450 point and shoot camera. This is not the case; I don't notice any difference, particularly in high contrast light, where the sky is almost always washed out white and the shadow areas are without detail.The camera ergonomics are also poor. The flash pops up on this camera, and is located exactly under your left hand index finger.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: diegoj
Reviews.Content: Works great, really good definitition, it's fast and works perfect.I, however, returned it after buying it because I found the Canon SX260 HS so much better and way cheaper! Consider looking at that camera first.

Reviews.Title: An excellent camera.
Reviews.Author: Jordan Webber
Reviews.Content: Now that the S100 is out, I imagine fewer people will be looking at this camera, but if you've found a good price, don't hesitate.  This is a great camera.  The lens is f/2.0 at its widest, which is pretty good in low light, although the smaller sensor (compared to a DSLR) will result in more noise.  My favorite thing about this camera is the ability to shoot RAW.  I have two Canon DSLRs and photos from this camera (when taken in good light using the RAW setting) come pretty close to matching the quality of some pictures from my DSLRs, and I'm not using cheap lenses!  This camera doesn't have the greatest telephoto abilities, but who buys a point and shoot for that?

Reviews.Title: Canon S95 review
Reviews.Author: arch
Reviews.Content: Canon S95 camera.PROS: Small, good lense, good quality photos,CONS: expensive, complex, have to print full user manual yourself.OVERALL:  I like it and I am still learning how to use it.

Reviews.Title: great choice
Reviews.Author: Isabella
Reviews.Content: excellent camera. Full of resources. Still need to learn to leave it alone, but the little that I found incredibly tested. Excellent night shots! Very happy with my choice!

Reviews.Title: S95, great but lacks "digital macro"
Reviews.Author: S95owner
Reviews.Content: I've owned a Canon SD800IS for a long time.  Its strengths are the economical size coupled with rich capability -- IMO it's as close as one can come to an SLR as possible without the bulk.  The SD800IS has been with me for many years, many outdoor adventures, and has captured many great pictures with no problems.  It still works well and I intend to keep using it, but we needed a second camera.The S95 seemed a suitable equal and now that I've had a chance to play with it, it's obviously a great device.  For the same price as I paid for the SD800IS many years ago, we now have an S95 with not only more capability to control image capture -- nearly full manual control of focus, aperture and exposure -- but a far superior ability to take low light pictures.  (as well as some other neat stuff with high appeal to the more casual photographer)There is one major omission to the camera's features, and it baffles me as to why Canon didn't program this into the S95.  There doesn't seem to be what they call a "digital macro" setting; that is, a setting that allows extremely close-up photos.  On the SD800IS, I can slip the camera into digital macro mode and take pictures of amazing things I can never see with my naked eye.  For example, I've captured rock crystals, fabric threads, lichen leaves, dew drops, leaf hair, and pin-head sized bugs far better than any other point-and-shoot camera I've ever owned.  Great fun!  Probably 20% of my photos with the SD800IS used digital macro.Not so on the S95.  Yes, using the S95's regular macro mode and then zooming the pictures in a photoshop program will probably achieve similar results -- given the S95's quality lens and sensor -- but it's really not the same as having the ability to see how the picture is framed and focused in the moment you take it.Canon, I'm a loyal consumer, but if you don't offer digital macro, I'm going to have to find another company.Another thing.  One reviewer complained about the flash popping up, hitting his finger, getting stuck, and then he has to restart the camera each time this happens.  This happened to me too, but repeated restarts did not clear the error.  I had to first push the flash down into the body, then it restarted OK.  Ick.  This seems pretty clunky; there must be a better way to handle this.  However, I'm not going to return the camera for this, simply because we don't like taking photos with the flash anyway -- and thank goodness for it's low light prowess!Lastly, we ordered a PSC-3200 case for this camera and it fits OK.

Reviews.Title: Best compact camera yet
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: This is the best compact camera I've bought yet. It's not an SLR replacement, though it's a great alternative to the bulkier Canon G10/11/12 series.The construction quality is slightly shabby for the price (plastic, loose fitting dials etc) but it certainly doesn't feel like it's about to fall apart.Image quality, low light performance and manual controls are far better than any other Canon Elph series compact I've tried.

Reviews.Title: best Point and Shoot ive ever used
Reviews.Author: R. Shanahan "shanny"
Reviews.Content: Has the ability of the manual functions to create your own picture. These work so great and easy to use once you get over the small learning curve. Have had this for over a year and have pumped out over hundreds of thousands of pictures and still the exact same quality as the first when I bought this. Recommend this to anyone. I have the S90 and don't use video but for the price I would go with the S95.

Reviews.Title: Low Quality.
Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: I owned this camera for about a week. I was very careful with it, never dropped it,abused it, etc. I'm zooming into take a photo with it, and all of a sudden the lens does something crazy, gets stuck, and my camera turns off saying lens error. I will be exchanging it for the a Panasonic. This was my first Canon, and i'm HIGHLY disappointed.

Reviews.Title: canon s95 error 18
Reviews.Author: H. Sanders
Reviews.Content: I would recommend anyone interested in this camera to do a quick google search of 'canon s95 error 18' before purchasing.  I wish I was aware of this problem before hand. If you still decide to take the risk of purchasing this camera, I recommend the following:1. Never touch the lens unit while shooting photos. 2. Never mistakenly turn it on in a pocket/case. 3. Never use this camera at the beach or anywhere near any sand/dust. 4. Obviously never drop the camera, especially while lens is extended.

Reviews.Title: S95 is top Ranked
Reviews.Author: Bruce D. Boss "Eclectlic Classical Listener"
Reviews.Content: I make 11 by 17 enlargements of my shots and usually use a good tripod.  I tested the S95 against a D300 Nikon system with a $2000 lens.  At 11 by 17"  I could not tell the diference.  This is after taking 60 pictures. Some of the pictures had seemed better with the S95.  I decided to sell all my Nikon equipment equipment for $7,000 and put that money in the bank.  Now, my tripod costs more that the S95 camera.

Reviews.Title: From an non professional everyday user...
Reviews.Author: USC Trojans!!
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how to use the manual controls of a camera. All this F-stop this or aperature that, I have no idea what people are talking about. All I knew was that I wanted to take great pictures on automatic. And this camera delivered! Due to the excellent lens this thing really takes crisp photos. Probably the best I have ever taken. I have a Canon SLR camera, and just shooting on automatic mode, this thing takes much better pictures. Outside in the night, no problem. It took great shots. Indoor it took great shots. Basically, in any low light situations, this thing will shine....Thats why I bought this camera. I have a Canon subcompact. Outside pictures it is fine, however, whenever shooting indoors or at night, it took horrible pictures. And the SLR I have is too big to use everyday. This thing was a dream come true. I was a little hesitant about buying yet another camera, but all my fears have been aleviated. The picture quality difference will be noticeable right away. I compared pictures at a dinner I went on with a few other couples. My camera blew the pants off there cameras pictures. Buy this, you wont be sorry!

Reviews.Title: don't buy
Reviews.Author: e22207
Reviews.Content: this camera took decent pictures.but just one year after owning it the lens stopped working.google it.apparently this and the newer Canon cameras have this problem.  The most important function of the camera -- opening and closing the lens -- is a small piece of plastic (everyone else uses metal) (no wonder it fails).MAJOR P.O.S.it isn't worth sending in to get repaired.

Reviews.Title: Almost to Perfect
Reviews.Author: Hutch
Reviews.Content: This camera is the ultimate High end Point and shoot. It has more features than you will use. Takes great indoor and outdoor moving pictures. the 720p video it takes can look amazing if shot from a tripod. Better than my old sony handycam

Reviews.Title: OUSTANDING
Reviews.Author: aOrtega
Reviews.Content: Pros:This camera is incredible! Provides outstanding pictures in all sorts of situations. With a tripod, it can take amazing shots at night. Would highly recommend this to someone who is wanting to expand their photo shooting hobby, but not willing to make the jump to SLR yet. For all of you SLR users, this camera will provide an outstanding back-up to your current set-up.Cons:Battery.......i just ended up buying an extra one.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT! A DREAM COME TRUE!!!!! GET IT....
Reviews.Author: L. Rose-Coates "Peaceful One"
Reviews.Content: I SUPER love this camera. Tried all the cool features in effects and was blown away! FUN to use .  If I can do it you can do it! It's user friendly. The HD video was easy to do and goes right to UTUBE with Quicktime.All I can say is BUY it. You can't go wrong. I f I could I'd buy one for all my friends & family.small but mighty. How in the world did they fit all that cool stuff into a small camera?

Reviews.Title: Poor chromatic aberration
Reviews.Author: Erudite Monkey
Reviews.Content: I purchased, and subsequently returned, this camera because the chromatic aberration in the RAW file was significantly worse than any camera (point and shoot or DLSR) I've ever used. CA is always present, especially in high contrast scenes, but the S95 produced images that required heavy reduction in Adobe Camera Raw. I've never had to use CA reduction to that extent before.The JPG produced a much cleaner image, but of course, I bought this camera because it can shoot RAW. Otherwise, I quite liked it.

Reviews.Title: finally stopped working after 20 months.
Reviews.Author: Becky "Becky"
Reviews.Content: I purchased my S95 through B&H; but since they no longer carry this product, I decided to share my review on Amazon. Therefore this review is not about the seller.I would describe my usage "moderate". Never dropped it, never took it near water. About 8 months ago, it started having trouble booting up. The problem was intermittent however. Although, I have missed many shots because of that. It got worse and worse...Doesn't matter if I just charged the battery a day ago, after 50 shots, the camera just  refused to power on! My options? a)send it in for repair ($149+) or b)get a refurbished one at a discount...Wow so you are telling me I have to pay more for this POS? No thanks.

Reviews.Title: took very nice pics ,until it break down
Reviews.Author: einat
Reviews.Content: I loved it at first , and it took really good pics until lance break down, after a fall.all the photos ware out of focus. still works, but most photos are blear and fuzzy . sad it was a waist of money .

Reviews.Title: Spectacular power in a small device
Reviews.Author: Tia
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I just bought it vs. the S100 due to price ($120+ cheaper) and some concerns about the low light reviews on the s100.  The picture quality is amazing as well as the flexibility of the camera.  The low light (no flash) photos are truly amazing.  The various modes - manual, etc allow you the flexibility to take just about any type of shot.  The only downside is that the software that comes with the product is really a relic of the late 90s.  Very poor user experience.  They should look a bit more at Apple or Flip for ideas.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, a couple things on the wish-list
Reviews.Author: D. Chen
Reviews.Content: I just used this camera on a vacation with a mix of indoor shots and outdoor shots (nothing really low-light though). I previously just used my iPhone 4's camera but read extensively about using manual controls before purchasing the s95, so I really looked forward to the manual mode. I ended up using the manual mode for almost all of my shots. I usually set it to ISO on the front and aperture/shutter time on the back, and 90% of the time, the aperture is set to largest (F2) to minimize shutter time and ISO. I wish I had known how the custom mode worked before my trip. You can set whatever settings you want and then go into the menu, click up once to get to the bottom of the menu options for "Save settings" and all your current settings, including the shooting mode go into Custom. I found the auto-WB to be pretty awful, so I had to set the shortcut button to the WB control. Fortunately, the auto-WB is acceptable in full AUTO mode. I wish there was a faster way to switch to AUTO mode temporarily. When I handed the camera to someone else to let them take a photo of me, it was usually set correctly if I had just been playing with it but sometimes it would be a bit dark or light, and it would be too much work to explain how to change the manual settings. I ended up just setting it to AUTO most of the time before handing it to someone else. I don't quite understand when I would use the other three modes (Aperture priority, shutter priority, and Program), and I wish I could just treat those three modes like three more Custom modes with full-auto control that remember their own settings.Overall, this is a great camera with awesome IQ and pretty intuitive controls for a budding enthusiast. I'm going to give it five stars because I got it during the Gold-box special for an insane price. Pretty much everything works fine. I didn't even have to swap batteries (took ~150 shots over 3 days but charged up every night) and the transfer process is dummy-proof using my macbook air and iPhoto (although iPhoto doesn't start up on its own when I plug in the camera but this might be a setting on my computer). I also do wish it had GPS, but I don't think built-in GPS is what I want. My iPhone has such rapid and accurate GPS acquisition since it also uses WIFI and cell towers to locate itself that I wish the camera could talk to the iPhone for GPS location. While I'm making up stuff I want, I also wish it could send files to the phone via bluetooth so then I could choose to instantly share the photo via text message or email or Facebook app.

Reviews.Title: Small package, big result
Reviews.Author: S. Oldman
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera and haven't read all of the instructions and options for it yet, but what I have played around with has produced superior results to the Olympus camera of mine that proceeded it.  The picture's colors are vibrant, but accurate, and the low light shooting that I have done has not been grainy at all.  I am very pleased with this camera so far.

Reviews.Title: A POCKET SIZE SLR!!!
Reviews.Author: Femaleballaonabudget
Reviews.Content: I am sooooooooo glad I have this camera!  I take pictures of EVERYTHING, people, buildings, food - you name it!  This captures all of your memories instantaneously with such great quality!I was intrigued with the S90 but was turned off when I discovered it didn't record video in HD.  I tried out the Canon SD4000 but when I took pictures of food in Macro, there was always a shadow on the bottom right corner.  I thought I had a defected camera but found out later that's just how the camera works.  I returned it and thank goodness the S95 had just been released!  It was definitely the talk of the town once it came in and people saw what great pictures this little thing took.  I had only had this camera for a week and I had already had at least 3 friends asking me what kind of camera I had so they could upgrade!If you ask someone else to take a picture for you with this camera and is unfamiliar with the camera, make sure you warn them of the possibility of the flash popping up!  I normally recommend how they should hold the camera.Ye, it is a bit pricey but its worth every penny.  This camera will definitely last you for years to come.  What more could you ask for?  Love love love!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Love it
Reviews.Author: Shawn Walters
Reviews.Content: My primary camera is a Nikon D2x, but I wanted a nice point and shoot to carry in my pocket and the S95 delivers.  PQ is excellent.  HD video is also excellent.  Also integrates perfectly with my macs.  Pics load up in iPhoto and videos in iphoto/quicktime.  Favorite feature is the ability to take pretty awesome shots without the use/need for a flash.I love it!!

Reviews.Title: Complete disappointment Canon
Reviews.Author: A. GONZALEZ
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on Nov 2010 with high hopes on it. Took it to a couple of trips, took a couple of photos but after 11 months the lens cover started to fail. I thought it was some dirt, so I cleaned it. It work for a little while but then again failed. Returned it to Canon for service and they said the camera is not repairable and NOT COVERED by the warranty!! (the said the found corrosion). What?!?!?!? I protected this camera like no other and they said it cannot be repaired because of corrosion??? what type of crappy materials are the using to build this camera?? A complete disappointment. BEWARE !!! this camera is very very sensible and will not last long. NOT RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: Poorly designed, breaks very easily
Reviews.Author: CharlieB
Reviews.Content: We had this camera for less than 6 months and it needs to be sent back to Canon to be replaced.  There is a design problem with the flash.  The flash mechanism is located right were your finger is placed when taking a picture.  If your finger inhibits the flash from rising, it breaks the mechanism.  One that happens, the camera is toast.  If you want to see how widespread the problem is, just google "wrong flash position restart the camera" and look at all of the people having the problem with the s90 and the s95.  We only used the camera a few times and it needs to be replaced.  Junk for such an expensive camera.  I had a panasonic prior to the canon and never had a problem.  This is the last canon that I will ever buy.

Reviews.Title: Why no viewfinder?!
Reviews.Author: M. Reynolds
Reviews.Content: I HAD to have this camera when it came out. I upgraded from an older point and shoot and moved to Canon from Nikon just to get the RAW and the easily adjustable aperture - since I love having a camera in my pocket when I travel on business - and not having to carry the D300 I use when I'm a tourist......But just try getting a good picture in the full sun when it is glaring off the screen! Unfortunately this isn't only about this camera as viewfinders on point and shoot cameras have essentially gone extinct. But on a camera like this - and for its likely target audience - it should have a viewfinder.Other than that - it is a nice camera and takes good pictures - but if you are really just using it as a point and shoot on Auto, the lens is a bit short for the price. And fortunately (knocking on wood here), I have not had any of the "shut down" issues that I have seen in other reviews......

Reviews.Title: Don't expect a useful manual
Reviews.Author: Sam "Sam"
Reviews.Content: The S95 is the best pocketable camera out there. I had an S90, loved it, and needed to replace it.I was surprised to get the S95  with only an abbreviated, quick start manual.  No full manual. A real manual is essential to fully benefit from this camera, as it has lots of neat and sophisticated features. You can download a PDF manual from Canon but it's very hard to read: the watermark label "COPY" is printed on every page and obscures the text. A tech rep at Canon says all their cameras are being shipped without a real manual. That's disappointing. If I had known I would have considered the competing high-end point and shoots which haven't adopted the no-manual policy. Shame, Canon.

Reviews.Title: Camera doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Arnold G. Tijerina III
Reviews.Content: The camera I received was defective. When I turn it on, the screen comes on but it takes a full minute for any of the buttons to work and be ready to take a picture. All of my online searches indicate this is a precursor to the dreaded "Lens Error". I then tried to order an Elph 300 HS and received it with the same result out of the box. Never ordering or buying a Canon again.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but don't buy it. The S100 is coming out soon.
Reviews.Author: hpsdafhoap
Reviews.Content: Simple review here. Canon has announced the S100 which improves on this camera by a lot. Better movie mode, potentially better sensor, better zoom, faster processor, etc. Similar price, so just wait for the S100.Canon PowerShot S100 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)

Reviews.Title: Quick review from multiple camera owner
Reviews.Author: HLK
Reviews.Content: I want to say first that I usually don't have time to write reviews but I felt it was important to write one for Canon's S95. I own several cameras, including Digital SLRs as well as several point and shoots. Every time I go out to purchase a camera I'm frustrated because no single camera is quite the right fit. I love Canon products but cannot recommend the S95 because of it's price and limitations. As several other reviewers have noted, the video on this camera is poor, it doesn't stay in focus, it's hard to focus, it's just too much work for a point and shoot. For stills, the low light capabilities of this camera are quite good, yet some of the images are blurred, so it's not great. My biggest complaint with this camera is it's too slow, there's a lag between shots which is simply unacceptable. I take a lot of photos and half of my shots are missed. Sometimes you only get one chance to take a shot, and that's it, gone forever. Really sucks! On the other hand every now and then the camera takes a great photo, usually when the subject is motionless. Also, as others have mentioned, the flash is located in an awkward spot. The bottom line: this camera has too many issues.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: As a pro-student this is one the best camera in the market,is 100% better that Panasonic Lx5,I just received 5 days ago and am so happy about quality and crisp pictures special low light, i gave 5 stars no doubt about it

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but experienced dreaded "lens error"
Reviews.Author: Irwin L. Goverman "govy1"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera from both the image quality and the creativity aspects. I own both the G11 and the Ti SLR, but wanted a camera that was small enough to pocket while visiting European cities. The quality of image, features and flexibility (I use the lens ring for exposure compensation) are wonderful. Battery life is somewhat mediocre compared to G11 or other point and shoots, but you'd want a spare battery anyway.I have gotten the dreaded lens error message, which has got me worried. This seems endemic to Canon cameras, but its fatal when it happens.  Camera simply refuses to extend lens, and gives you the E18 Lens Error message. It went away, but do you trust it to be your "only" camera on a once-in-a-lifetime trip?

Reviews.Title: Returned To Amazon
Reviews.Author: R. Empson "rempson"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to use when unable to take along the DSLR.  I was most disappointed in this camera, as I had read so much good in regard to it.  The controls were nice, the size would probably be a problem after a bit - the flash was very awkward and I missed the viewfinder.  I could have lived with all of that if the image quality was better. It was hit and miss. Sometimes great and sometimes lousy, with the main problem being over-exposed.  Amazon was great about letting me return it - will probably go with the Canon G12.Have since purchased and received the Canon G12 from Amazon. It is a great camera and the image quality is much better in auto. Looking forward to using this with my DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Very good, but with a couple minor knocks ...
Reviews.Author: Jimmy the meek
Reviews.Content: This is likely about my 10th Canon camera I've purchased over the years and as far as the non-SLR's, takes the best pics overall.  My only knocks are that A)One of the reasons I purchased this camera is because of the "low light" mode on the dial.  Takes good enough pics but it's locked at the "M" picture size setting which is only 2.5 MP's.  You CAN'T take full 10 MP pics in the "low light" mode.  The other knock as others have mentioned is the flash pop up is in absolutely the WORST possible place it could be. It's exactly where your left index finger is supposed to hold and steady the camera.  Takes a lot of getting used to.Other than that, I swear by Canon cameras and never had any major problems with any over the years.

Reviews.Title: Don't pay over $369!
Reviews.Author: Jason Rene "Jason"
Reviews.Content: Tired of sellers price-gouging you?  Don't buy this item if it costs more than $369.  That's the sale price at most sellers as of December 1, 2010.  As inventory fluctuates, sellers increase their prices automatically, at one point increasing over $70 more here on Amazon!  Don't let them take advantage of you.  The prices will decrease as soon as inventories restock; you can wait.  If we buyers refuse to buy when the price gets too high, it will force the sellers to keep the price reasonable.

Reviews.Title: ALMOST USELESS FOR  MANUAL OPERATION
Reviews.Author: Satisfied customer
Reviews.Content: This camera is advertised and promoted by Canon as a compact camera with manual mode "loaded with all a serious photographer's must-haves"...it isn't.I contacted Canon customer service and they verified all of the following problems;(1) Most disappointing is the fact that this camera has no light meter.  For those of us who understand how to use manual operation this means that even if you can control the f Stop and shutter speed separately, you will have no way of knowing if you exposure is correct.  So, it is almost impossible to use manual mode and alter the depth of field or do any kind of exposure variations.  Canon confirmed this.(2) This camera's highest F stop is f5.6 in telephoto and f8 in wide.  This seriously limits your ability to gain long distance depth of field, so landscape photography or travel pics in which you want a large area to be in focus are out of the question.  It basically works within the same range that a point and shoot camera works; at 3 to 4 times the price.(3) The operating manual is almost useless.  It is nothing but an exercise in putting in the battery, turning it on and snapping a picture.  It has almost no instructions about mode variations and nothing on the use of manual mode (now I know why).  I spent hours working through the menus and was still having trouble using it.  I got so frustrated that I called Canon; their tech support person couldn't explain it's use and had to get a supervisor to tell me that I was correct about points 1 and 2 above.(4) The zoom lever (at least on the one I received) is not smooth at all; it zooms too fast and sometimes it is slow to start.  This causes a bunch of back and forth zooming to get the composition that you want.  I realize that this is a compact camera but most of the controls are hard to manipulate and I have small hands.(5) It has no viewfinder.  For some this will not be a problem but for me; I like looking through a viewfinder not an LCD screen.This camera has serious limitations. I didn't expect it to be the same as my SLR but it does not even come close to an SLRs manual operation and for $425, and the way Canon promotes it, it should.If you understand how to use a camera in manual mode,coupled with a light meter and this is how you want to use this camera, you will be very disappointed. If you just want to shoot pictures of the friends and family etc, then you would be much better off spending $100-$150 on a good point and shoot and using it in auto mode.

Reviews.Title: Meh
Reviews.Author: TBKHomeworld
Reviews.Content: I had really hoped for more from my S95.  I preferred my Canon SD1000 and SD1100 than I did this unit.  Sure, this has better specs and abilities than those older cameras but those cameras took very quick shots, were great on color recreation, and the flash was able to recycle really quick, you know...the things you _want_ in a P&S; unit.  My S95 has been a disappointment with washed out pictures, hues off, slow response time, and dismal recycle time to take the next shot.My Samsung S3 cellphone takes better pictures than this does!

Reviews.Title: Expected more for the price
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for the last 3 months and my feeling is that I should not have bought it. At this price its getting close to Nikon J1 and you get a lot more with Nikon J1. I know J1 is bigger, but still small enough to fit a lot of pockets. I was disappointed with S95's Image Quality. I thought some of the cheaper Canon's own point and shoot performed just as well. I'm going to give my away to my sister maybe and just buy J1. If i want small point and shoot, i think any cheaper Canon point and shoot will be just as good.

Reviews.Title: Jump on this!
Reviews.Author: Long Island Dad
Reviews.Content: At it's current low price, it's nearly 1/2 the cost of the newer S100 and an amazing camera for bargain hunters.

Reviews.Title: Amazon, best service ever !!!!!
Reviews.Author: S.O
Reviews.Content: Actually, i'm giving it 5 stars for Amazon service, other people gave here a wonderful detailed review for this black pearl ( as i like to call it ;) ), and upon this reviews I bought it, but honestly Amazon service and its way in handling order problems is Amazing, thanks a lot Amazon for your wonderful service

Reviews.Title: (Formerly) Worthless
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L Peters
Reviews.Content: Update!  I charged up the battery one last time to see if anything had changed, prior to selling it for parts.  Upon inserting the battery, the camera began to work like new!?!?!  Glad to have it back in action, but it goes to show that Canon was trying to suck more money out of me.  Obviously it was not completely unrepairable as they stated, seeing that it just decided to work again.  It has been working fine for probably the last month and has not had any problems since the power issue.  The only thing that I can attribute to the resurrection is that I moved from a humid climate to a very dry one.Original Story:Short story:Camera lived for two months.  It broke overnight and Canon claims that it was corrosion.  The camera was never subjected to anything other than humidity.  Canon did not care and offered a refurbished one for $174.11.  The camera did not take the best pics either, as my S400 took better ones and it is only 4 MP vs the 10MP S95.  Probably will not buy Canon anymore, as they seem to be making junk.  Evidence of this can be seen by the many other reviews online about corrosion issues with the S95. Just search S95 corrosion and you will see.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: lori beccaria white
Reviews.Content: CAMERA STARTED FREEZING ONLY AFTER ONE YEAR OLD.  COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY.  CANON WANTS $150 PLUS SHIPPING FLAT RATE TO FIX CAMERA.  MISSED PRICELESS PHOTO OPPORTUNITIES BECAUSE OF CAMERA FREEZING WHEN TRYING TO USE IT.  NO MORE CANONS IN MY HOUSE.

Reviews.Title: Not enough Zoom for me
Reviews.Author: Kindle Obsessed "JKL"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this and the Sony DSC-HX5V last week to compare.  My old camera is a Sony Cyber Shot DSC-H1 from 2005 with a 12x zoom.  My sister swears by Canon so I wanted to give this a try.  I took the Canon S95 to a wedding rehearsal and the Sony DSC-HX5V to the wedding the next day.  I found the the Sony to be easier to use, easier to focus, and I just loved the zoom.  I am one who can't live without a good zoom.  The Sony has a 10x zoom.This Canon was hard for me to focus for some reason.  It didn't focus fast enough.  Maybe it is because I am used to Sony, I don't know.  I thought I'd give it a try based on all the good reviews, but mine is going back.  I also found it was harder to hold than the sony.  It didn't feel comfortable in my hands--small with no definitive place to put fingers.  The Sony has a nicer feel to it with a spot for your thumb to rest on the back.The CanonS95 is also heavier.  Some like this as it feels sturdier, but I like the lighter feel of the Sony.

Reviews.Title: S95 vs. G12
Reviews.Author: SG
Reviews.Content: I'll be straight to the point. I've owned an S90 (same thing as S95) but sold it when S95 was announced. But then the G12 was announced as well, so I did some research and testing. I came to the conclusion that despite the fact that S95 and G12 have the same sensor and image processor, the G12 makes better pictures! I'm not sure if it's the lens or something else, but after I compared my pictures taken with the S90 and then the G12, the latter have visibly LESS noise in low light, are sharper straight out of the camera, and less blurry in the seemingly same shooting conditions (much more keepers when photographing moving subjects or shooting in low light with slow shutter). I own a few DSLR cameras and I am almost totally happy with the G12 as a compact substitute. I was only so-so happy with the S90, even though it's a very nice camera. So, if you are deciding between the two cameras, try them both and see for yourself. To me, the difference is very real.

Reviews.Title: Review: Canon S95 vs. Nikon S8100
Reviews.Author: N. Chawla "neerajc"
Reviews.Content: I just tried both these models for 2 days - borrowed it from a friend (Thanks Jig!).  I've owned Canons for about 10 years (SLRs, P&S; models), and have been looking for a P&S; camera that would take good videos - especially indoors - have low light sensitivity and have a big zoom (at least 7x or higher).  Here are my comparison points - both are quite disappointing with pluses showing strengths and minuses showing weaknesses/issues.  You decide what works for you based on your requirements.  I'm keeping price out as a comparison datapoint.Nikon S8100 Review+ Superb resolution of screen+ Can zoom while shooting video (in and out) - the camera retains focus - slow, but gets there - indoors has a lot of trouble finding focus while zooming in/out- Videos inside the house even with many light bulbs on are very dark - almost unusable at times - poor quality+ Colors both inside and outside in light are very accurate - much more than S95+ 10x is a fantastic zoom for shooting stills or videos- battery life poor- no external charger - have to connect it to computer to charge (do they sell separate charger?)+ flash is one of the brightest I've seen in a Point and Shoot - excellent!+ Press a button for shooting video - ever ready mode- Pressing the record button to 'stop' recording takes a while- Camera crashed on me once with an error message - I had to remove battery to reboot- Can hear all sorts of motor noises/sounds while camera is even trying to find focus - when you zoom in/out, you can hear motor sounds+ even though its not a fast lens (f2.0), the low light sensitivity is quite good - must be the CMOS sensorCanon S95 Review- Overall underwhelmed by this camera - I've been a big fan (and prior owner) of the S series and have owned 2 Canon SLR's+ Good low light sensitivity to pictures indoors+ Videos indoors are very usable due to sensitivity of sensor- Garish colors at times - I can't believe a camera with the internals of the G12 is confused with colors in the Auto WB setting- Poor resolution of screen compared to Nikon (half the resolution)- Poor job of color accuracy - struggles with CF bulbs and cloudy skies - too much yellow or blue tints+ can shoot in RAW hence can do lossless editing in Lightroom or Photoshop- big negative - can't keep focus once you start zooming in while shooting a video- separate dial mode to get to for shooting video+ zooming in and out are slow but can't hear motor sounds while shooting video- 4x is minor zoom - most cameras have a lot more these days

Reviews.Title: Canon S95 camera from Adorama
Reviews.Author: novice
Reviews.Content: I ordered a complete camera package from amazon.com.  The Canon S95 came from Adorama and was shipped separately from the memory card & case.  The camera arrived, I followed all of the instructions and kept getting a "lens error" message.  After spending too much time researching this in the "getting started" book, the on-line "how-to" CD and online with Canon tech support, I decided to return the camera.  The process was fairly easy but...I had to pay for the return shipping and insurance which was $14!!  It was free shipping to get to me!!  I was never able to take a picture!  I got another Canon S95 camera from a local Best Buy for same price - no shipping fees and have been happily taking pictures ever since.

Reviews.Title: Little package ... Big return.
Reviews.Author: larry
Reviews.Content: I offer a full package of digital options to my clients ... that includes point and shoot without the "intrusion" of my Cannon tank. My clients want it yesterday. I tether to MyFi for real time live results. The S95 beats all my competition in all categories. Lars

Reviews.Title: Canon S95.
Reviews.Author: San
Reviews.Content: Hello all. This is a great camera. The price is low and I could not resist it. It is good for low light. The video quality is not bad either. So overall it is a good buy from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: My New Favorite Toy
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Hughes "Lady B 5"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying and almost waited too late but I finally managed to get may hands on the Canon S95.  I looked in many places since Amazon had none in stock but I found one at another site.  I had the S90 and loved it, so when Canon came out with this upgrade I just had to have it.  I have only had it since Friday but it is now my new favorite toy.  I love the quality of the low light pictures and this new mini movie mode is just too cool.  Hope they come back in stock soon so everyone that wants one can have it.

Reviews.Title: Seems like i did not get a brand new camera
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: packaging that came for the camera was not sealed, looked as if the camera was opened before and was tested before. Is this what i get for buying it via amazon gold box deal of the day?product wise, there is plenty of reviews of the S95 and i shall not add on to it. Happy with camera capability, upset with he fact that it is probably not a brand new set.

Reviews.Title: The S90 was a breakthrough, not this...
Reviews.Author: Victoria "Vikki K."
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is very similar and canon seems to be making as few improvements on some P&Ss; as possible to sell the next one.  (Perhaps lens' and DSLRs are their cash cow.)I have this camera and a Canon 300 HS (replaced by the 310 HS).  The 300 is even smaller and more simple to carry.  It is cheaper.  Pictures (Auto, Program) are surprisingly close in quality.  So is speed.  The CMOS sensor on the 300 is excellent and not bad in low light.  The 300 is 5x and the S95 is 4x.  (RAW is now even possible with the 300.)Somehow, the smaller 300 has better video (e.g., 1080) and a dedicated video button.Yes, the S95 has some advantages (faster lens but only at the wide end) and a better LCD.  Of course it has manual controls that the 300 lacks but a serious photographer looking for a small camera would be better served by a XZ-1 with its 1.8 - 2.5.  Or get a D3100/T3(i) if excellent photos are what you're after.Unfortunately, the modest improvements (if any) Canon trend appears to have continued with the S100.  Canon is starting to lose me in terms of P&Ss.;  Perhaps it is their marketing.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: tim
Reviews.Content: awesome I luve it it is a great value if you are looking for a great camera grab this one

Reviews.Title: Difficult to Use
Reviews.Author: Music Lover
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift. Although it is a nice camera, it was not what I was looking for. I wanted a true "point and shoot" camera. And this camera is not really that. It is bulkier than many other point and shoots and is considerably heavier than my last camera (a Casio Exilim). Unless you are shooting in Auto mode, I find it hard to use. There are a lot of controls that are hidden within other areas. I spent more than 20 minutes trying to figure out where the black and white picture feature was. It takes good pictures, but if just shooting on "auto" mode, I do not find the pictures so amazing that it is worth the price tag.I also want to add that I absolutely HATE the flash feature. Whoever made this camera, should not have had the flash pop out the way that it does. There are so many times where my figure is covering the flash, because that is the natural place for someone to put their finger when taking a picture. So this is a huge issue for me. Especially when giving someone else the camera to take a picture. I wish that they made the camera a little larger so the flash could be included in the design.Maybe I am biased because this is not the camera that I had wanted, but so far I am not impressed with the value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Nice Point & Shoot with an extra flare for the Creative.
Reviews.Author: Tenant
Reviews.Content: This camera lives up to all the good reviews it has received. When I had it, I felt inclined to take pictures of everything, like a pile of dead leaves and a lifeless USB plug from various angles. Anyways, I had to return it when I found out the Canon S100 had better HD video recording and zooming/focusing functions. Nevertheless, I enjoyed it when I had it and would highly recommend it to anyone interested in quality photos and having some creative control when the urge arises.1/2012. Wow - I noticed the price is about $130 more than when I bought this camera this past November. Price hiked up days after I returned it. Hmmmm....maybe I should have kept it.

Reviews.Title: every "action" shot is blurred....what a disappointment
Reviews.Author: shelleyL
Reviews.Content: i bought the Canon S95 as I need my camera to do all the work for me, so thought this sounded like one of the best "point and shoots".....anyway, I have been taking photos of my 2 year old dancing (with the camera set to Auto, as instructed in the booklet), and EVERY shot is blurred around the hands, hair and eyes.....AAAARRRGGGH,HOW frustrating.  this was the exact reason I binned my old Sony Cybershot.I am very disappointed and am now thinking this camera can go the same way as the Sony!(does anyone have any ideas how to get clear "action" shots -please share if you do, thanks)

Reviews.Title: I got a lemon , bad pixel on the CCD sensor
Reviews.Author: Ryoasuka
Reviews.Content: Found a bad pixel on the LCD when review the picture with camera . It's still there when reviewing on computer monitor , that means it's not the LCD screen but the CCD sensor . It's pretty big black spot especially viewing the HD-video .Additionally, the cover for the HDMI port is very loose , looks cheap . Picture quality is so so .I returned it already , planning for LX5

Reviews.Title: Disappointed, but Optimistic
Reviews.Author: G. Guarnere
Reviews.Content: I love Canons.  They're the only brand I will look at when purchasing digital cameras.  I have a Rebel, but purchased this S96 to replace my trusty SD800 (that I've had for YEARS).Out of the box, I was highly disappointed.  The camera has a VERY cheap feel to it, and there wasn't even a basic memory card with which to test out the camera.  Luckily, I always have an extra one in my purse, so I popped it in and set to work.Clarity is impressive (most important part, right?).  The photos seem crisp and the colors are true.  The menu options (as many other posters have opined) really are quite intuitive.  I wasn't so happy about the facial recognition, though, as it has failed to pick up on a face or two that should have been glaringly obvious.I dunno... I have to admit being worried about the durability of this camera.  The shell seems to be so... cheap.  I don't spike my cameras onto concrete, but considering I've got a toddler, my cameras certainly take their bumps.  I sincerely hope this one is up to the task of providing exceptional pictures while enduring the occasional bump to the case.Update:  Two of the pixels were burned out and had to send back to Amazon for replacement.  Amazon's service is AMAZING!  In the meantime, tested out the camera some more and here's what I've got:Movie quality - Impressive.  Sound quality leaves something to be desired if you're not incredibly close to the camera, but the video quality itself is astounding.  Even up on a big-screen, playback is incredible.  It rivals my hand-held Mini DV.  I am absolutely floored by the clarity and smoothness of this function!Flash - works well if a little slow at times.  Remember if you're using auto to make sure the flash is already up and out of the camera before attempting to do your work!  It takes time to slide itself out of the case.Exposure - you can change this pretty quickly if you're into it.  Otherwise, stick with auto which also works spot-on.Red-eye Reduction - doesn't seem to work as well as my Canon SD800.  That surprised me a bit, and I'm wondering if that had anything to do with the particular camera I got.  I'll be double checking this when the new one comes in.ISO - Where's the ISO button???  No ISO button makes me a sad, sad photographer.  Also no selectable auto-focus point.  That made me bummed, too.Outside "shell" or casing - I'm still not happy about this, because it honestly feels very cheap.Still, picture clarity is downright gorgeous.  I cannot argue with a camera that is capable of taking such stunning photographs.  The price and size of this camera blow its competitors out of the water.

Reviews.Title: Not all that...
Reviews.Author: D. B. Smith "Amazon Addict"
Reviews.Content: 1. Plastic flap of a door to access output ports is flimsy and likely to break off quickly.2. No way to adjust light metering zones (at least I haven't found it).3. Why does every manufacturer use a different style connector for USB cables?!4. No in-built memory -- you have to buy a memory card to use the camera at all!5. Pop-up flash head hits you in the finger every time. Only way to continue is to power off/on.I've been using this Canon along side a Sony DSC H70. The Canon lens is faster (at wide angles) but, otherwise, I think the Sony is a much better camera. It's also significantly less expensive.Not impressed, Canon.

Reviews.Title: S95: A Tad on the Overrated Side
Reviews.Author: wolfman
Reviews.Content: Bottom line: it's a fantastic little camera, but some things about it are VERY stunted.Cons:-Battery life: the worst I've ever experienced with a digital camera (the first day I got it, I played with it for a few hours and it died after only taking a handful of pics).-Shutter release button: placed awkwardly to the left of what feels natural.-Flash: pops-up where you are forced to hold the camera (very startling and potentially dangerous to the inner workings of the camera, especially if one is gripping the body too tightly upon deployment).-Only records video in 720p (My iPhone can do that). Also, there is no manual control while shooting video.-Lens: not exceptionally wide; not exceptionally long - this rules out shooting in small rooms and zooming into subjects more than 10ft away from you. Lame. Also, keep in mind that when you zoom with this camera, you lose the f/2.0 aperture; it becomes pinched down to, I believe, f/4.9. This is not unique to pont-and-shoot zoom lensed cameras, but it is something to consider.-The protruding lens ring makes it slightly awkward to find a decent (and affordable) carrying case.-No bulb exposure mode!?-Highest ISO settings are saved at a mere 2.5 megapixels, and user has no manual control such as white balance, etc. while taking the photo (here I'm refering to low-light mode).

Reviews.Title: broken control ring
Reviews.Author: Sang Lee
Reviews.Content: It took great pictures...but the control ring was not functioning.  Had to return it and hopefully the next one will work as advertised.  No problems with photos...and with great results...but 3 stars for broken ring.  I could not "google" any other instances of a defective control ring, scoured the manual to see if i was missing something...but no...just a broken product.  Lemon? maybe...if anyone else has a similar problem, would be curious to hear about it.

Reviews.Title: VERY DISAPPOINTING CAMERA.
Reviews.Author: Amazoniac
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera, once i got it though i was extremely disappointed. I ended up returning it the day after i recieved it.-IQ: EXTREMELY NOISY, NO SHARPNESS, NOT SO GOOD DETAIL. These things combined equalled HORRIBLE IMAGE QUALITY.-BAD IN LOW LIGHT-BAD IN GOOD LIGHT (WOW)-THIS IS A TRUE POCKET CAMERA, I KNEW IT WAS COMPACT BUT THIS THING IS TOO SMALL TO HOLD (FOR ME). PEOPLE MIGHT LIKE THIS THOUGH.-SLOW FOCUSING-NOT THE DSLR COMPANION OTHERS SWEARED IT TO BE.I GUESS IT WOULD BE OKAY IF IT WAS LIKE 229.99 OR SOMETHING....but even at that price id feel uncomfortable buying it. not recommended.

Reviews.Title: Garbaqe quality
Reviews.Author: Stan Peyton "allmaya"
Reviews.Content: Have used Canon cameras for over 20 years, so this experience surprised me.Bought the S90 and was blown away by its capacities.  Unfortunately, after only 15 months of ownership, the motor that powers the lens in an out quit.  Upon doing research on the net, I learned that this is a common problem.  Because I like the camera so much, I spent the $170 to get Canon to repair it.Ten weeks later, the dials where you choose the function froze.  The camera had not left the house, in other words, it certainly was not abused by me.  Canon is happy to fix it for another $170.Canon will not stand behind their products.  DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: Solution to Lens error
Reviews.Author: silent warrior
Reviews.Content: I know how frustrating it wud be if such an high end camera stop working , please refer the link below which has good DIY fixes[...]

Reviews.Title: OK pictures, flash is unnerving and overflashes, strap is idiotic
Reviews.Author: Digger
Reviews.Content: I find that this camera takes the same type / quality pictures as my SD970 and SD850 did when they were new.  I was really hoping for the vibrant pictures I see other cameras get.  It does take flash pictures much, much faster than the SD970, but unfortunately they are all way overflashed.  The pop-up flash is completely unnerving, as it pops up right where you hold the camera, and puts me on edge when I use it -- instead of concentrating on the shot, I concentrate on making sure I'm very delicately holding the camera away from the flash.  Even then it still gets me and I jerk, often messing up the picture.  The other thing I completely don't understand is the included strap.  The S95, like the SD970, come with a strap that doesn't have the slider clip to keep it securely on your wrist, so the camera just falls right off, and I had to re-use the normal one from the SD850.

Reviews.Title: customer service
Reviews.Author: Matthieu Ivan Pierre
Reviews.Content: Canon's customer service are totally useless ! and this camera is to slow, bad bad bad bad bad bad bad

Reviews.Title: No Video
Reviews.Author: Peter H. Baisley "Beesneeze"
Reviews.Content: All in all, this camera lives up to the hype in the reviews: just don't expect it to shoot quality video. YOU CANNOT FOCUS WHILE SHOOTING MOVIES. So, if your subject moves, you have to move with it, or else all you get is a blurry mess in HD. No auto focus, no manual focus, nothing.The video is such an after thought in this camera, I wish that they had just left it out rather than taking up precious button / CPU space. GPS tagging or some other function would have been way more useful.

Reviews.Title: WARNING - European charger, no English manual
Reviews.Author: LH
Reviews.Content: This is not a review of the camera since I haven't really been able to use it.  When this camera arrived the charger it came with is model number of CB-2LYE which comes with a cord for European outlets and I live in the US.  There was also no English manual for the camera.  The product description clearly states that the charger is CB-2LY (I assume the "E" on mine means European).  I called Amazon and I had to put a second camera on my credit card to get them to send me a replacement US-based camera.  The second camera arrived yesterday and it has the same European charger!  I've posted a picture above.  I've called Amazon again and they're "opening a ticket" to check their inventory.  The second camera came from a different vendor, but it was still fulfilled by Amazon, so it appears they manage all the inventory.  If you order this camera from Amazon right now be advised you'll likely get one with a European charger.In terms of the camera, it seems really nice.  I used it a bit as the battery came about 67% charged.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but....
Reviews.Author: Marc Loren "PC Geek"
Reviews.Content: Great camera, so I wont post what everyone already knows about. What I will say is that I have yet to be able to get the auto focus to work in Macro mode (Tulip Icon). All pictures are slightly blurred.  If someone knows how to get this to work, please post a reply. Other than this, I would recommend the S95.

Reviews.Title: inadequate video function
Reviews.Author: Y. Li
Reviews.Content: A lot of Canon fans here seemed to dismiss the inadequate video function of this camera. For average consumers like me, I would like to use a camera for both photography and video taping. I want good quality in both functions, so I can keep them for a long time to come, showing them off on the big screen TV. A lot of those pictures and videos will be taken in casual/family settings. So a dSLR is out of question.I am pretty sure Canon has the technology. But to omit the autofocusing and zooming, and applying only 24 frame rate in their high end PAS camera is inexcusable. Maybe they are already thinking about the next model.This camera is a rip-off for those who has S90 and wants to upgrade. Once the Panasonic LX5's price drops, it will become a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: S95
Reviews.Author: Mark Lindamood
Reviews.Content: Canon - Please put the guts of the S95 camera into the old SD-870 case.  The exoskeleton on this model totally fails compared to the other, and pop-up flash is a real nuisance, and surely took up greater space inside to boot.  And what?  --  no flat end to stand the camera up endwise for a timer shot portrait vice landscape?  What were you thinking?  Also, return time lapse video without partial defocusing for "miniature."  Keep both, but there was no need to kill regular time-lapse.  And next time, go 24mm wide.  Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: A. Santos
Reviews.Content: We were tricked into buying this camera because of the reviews written in Amazon and BestBuy. The camera might be able to take pictures in low light but when there is too much light under the auto mode, the pictures do not come out correctly. I used a cheaper Canon camera owned by a friend and it took a better picture, in the same setting. For lack of better words and technical terms about photography, my wife and I just know that this camera does not take good photos when there is unbalanced light in the background under auto mode.
