We were looking for a camera that takes good pictures under auto mode because my wife is not very technical. This camera just brought frustration and cost us $60 in restocking fee at BestBuy. We ended up buying a Nikon Coolpix S8100 camera which is $100 cheaper and performs better. I am writing this review not hating Canon, I have used other Canon camera, I just want others to know that there are other options other than this camera. It does not perform well under the auto mode. You might have to play around with settings that applies to the photo that you need to take. But most of the time, a non-technical user does not want to do this. Bottom line, take a look at other models, this is really a bad camera, at least the one we bought.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Prasanna "Prasanna - The Trojan"
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera, but you got to have  awesome  people to take picture off.  * Make it fun! Who says you can't be informative and entertaining?  * How about a little action? If it makes sense, cut to the product in use as you describe your experiences with it.

Reviews.Title: Lens error obituary
Reviews.Author: MDinBH "Lawrence Koplin"
Reviews.Content: Waited and waited for this camera to come out, preordered it and did a dance when it arrived.Fabulous photos, but so much to learn about it.Well, no worries actually.Second day I had it, I put it in a new soft belt case which was more protection than any pocket camera I've ever owned.  Within two hours, something had happened while in the pouch, so that when about to take a very important photo- the dreaded "lens error" message appeared.The lens was stuck in the closed position, I researched and called and blogged.This camera was supposed to come to India with me this November on a National Geographic photographic expedition.  It wasn't even capable of a dinner party in Los Angeles.Kudos to Amazon, though.  I sent the camera back.... hmmmm, do I want a replacement or a full refund?I took the refund- shame on me if the next one breaks in India.Make a stronger, better camera without plastic gears in the lens, Canon!!!!!!!I have a Panasonic Lumix in my pocket today (no case, not necessary) and am waiting for the Nikon P7000, which I have preordered, to arrive.I should be just find on my trip.LK

Reviews.Title: Mediocre
Reviews.Author: czar
Reviews.Content: I got my hands on this camera. I was expecting a magical camera...but unfortunately my expectations were perhaps higher. Low light images are only slightly better than the typical compact. Lots of grains even starting at 200 ISO. Day light pictures are decent but not as good as the Panasonic models. Low Light is better than Panasonic but still poorer than a 3 year old DSLR.This camera is good in all ways except the pictures are ordinary/mediocre. If you think you will get magical pictures...forget it. Its okay. But not good enough for $400. Just get a used DSLR for under $300 and those $120 cameras for those portable needs.Don't expect money to beat the laws of physics...for Low Light pics and moving subjects you need a big area to capture light. At day light most compacts including this will do decently.Update:There seems to be a cult of Canon S90/S95. Next time I would stay away from Over Hyped products. I just bought a Nikon Dslr. I took 300 pics, in just auto and scene modes. No fiddling with the settings. The pics just came out magical. And the DSLR just cost me 100 more than the current price of this mediocre Canon. For my portable needs I would stick with the iphone. For folks who dont have a iphone just get a $60 refurbished point and shoot with low Mega Pixels.Too much Mega Pixels would ruin a pic from a P&S.;

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT :)
Reviews.Author: dmonster
Reviews.Content: I love the camera so far because it's the best quality digital camera I've bought in the last month.. (I've bought 5!) I don't know why but maybe its the economy.. my 2003 Sony T60 works better than any new camera that has come out :( It's so disappointing.. the new sony 90/900 doesn't even compare with the older model.. SOMETHING MUST BE DONE! And as for Canon, the SD940 doesn't compare to this... but my 2005 Canon camera is way better than the SD940 and this S95 I just bought!! THE S95 is too complicated for me :) I just want a point and shoot camera with the picture quality S95 is giving me.

Reviews.Title: Two Duds and Amazon Says No More - decent camera though
Reviews.Author: Matt David
Reviews.Content: I owned the S90 and I loved it.  I loved the build quality and the only reason I sold it was to purchase the 550D.  I knew the S95 was in the near future and the S90 held its value and I received a 100% return which made purchasing the s95 even more appealing.I've had the 550D for 5+ months and I was starting to miss the small form factor of my beloved S90.  Obviously, I purchased the S95 when the price dropped.  Unfortunately the problems I've encountered (which oddly aren't showing up for others) are unacceptable.  My issue can be seen by searching "s95 defective lcd" on youtube.. it's the first video.  I received 1 replacement and the issue was worse than the original S95.  I emailed amazon, stating that the same problem was occurring with the replacement.  I made it clear that this "was" the camera I've chosen to be my P&S;, but they replied with an email stating that they were not going to send anymore replacements.  I've been directed to return it for a refund.  They did send the replacement with overnight delivery, so props for that.The camera itself seems pretty nice.  The few photos I took seemed on par with the S90.  Though, switching from different modes seemed sluggish compared to the S90. (or maybe I'm just use to the response time of the 550D)  The menu system also seemed slower than the S90 I had.I think I'm just unlucky.  The first S90 I purchased had problems with the pop-up flash.  The first 550D I purchased had problems with the front dial.Maybe I'll wait for the S100.. maybe Amazon knows something I don't.

Reviews.Title: Never to shop again shop from ADORAMA camera
Reviews.Author: alem
Reviews.Content: Two months ago, I have purchased two Canon S95 Cameras from Adorama Camera. One of the cameras had a faulty screen: a very bright and disturbing dead pixel on the sensor  right in the middle of the screen and a huge unusual red smear on the screen that looks as if there is a burst of red ink under the lcd screen.I reported the problem to Adorama and asked for a repairment/replacement but they refused to do anything about it as their "30 days" guarantee is over.So be aware that you're left with no guarantee from Adorama customer service once your purchase is 30 days and over!  I learn my lesson, I will NEVER order from ADORAMA again under these ridiculous "guarantee" terms that they are imposing.

Reviews.Title: you get what you pay
Reviews.Author: quentin
Reviews.Content: I get this stuff by 224 dollar. And when I received it this morning, I found the lence had some adhesive in its  tiny gap. So the lence looks ugly. But the camera works fine. I think it may be a defective good or refubished one. Be aware of those cheap stuff in website.

Reviews.Title: Powerful Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Mae
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera to take to Disneyland because I lost mine in Florida. I was strictly Canon, but now I must say that I love the Panasonic Lumix. It takes fantastic picture. I have a Canon 50D and its such a pain to carry with me on hikes, amusement parks etc... This one has a very nice lens. The colors are robust. I wish I can bring the F stop lower but 3.0 for a point and shoot is cool... For something compact that takes like SLR quality pictures the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 is for you!

Reviews.Title: a little pricey for the quality
Reviews.Author: Linda Hansen
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for several months and overall I'm only mildly impressed. The problem is that the picture quality is not as good as my iPhone 4, and for the price I expected much more. The camera is pretty easy to carry around and it looks cool, but I'm sure there are many others at lower prices with the same or superior picture taking abilities.

Reviews.Title: WE ARE IN THE USA!!!!
Reviews.Author: Christian Deering
Reviews.Content: So I am going on vacation to Toronto for the very first time so i order this camera. The camera arrives a few days before I am supposed to leave. It was sent with a European charger. WHY??!! WHY, would an AMERICAN based company send a camera with a European charger to an AMERICAN address. Common Sense goes a long way!!! Needless to say I went to Toronto without a camera...Thank You so very much.

Reviews.Title: Is it a new one as seller claimed: new
Reviews.Author: Chong
Reviews.Content: Why there is no protect film on LCD screen when I first took it out from the box. It functions OK so far.

Reviews.Title: Great for a pocket camera
Reviews.Author: William Nix
Reviews.Content: If you want a camera to carry in your pocket this camera is the best. But, for a few more $ you can get the Pentax k-7. The k-7 photo quality and video quality are excellent.  Pentax K-x 12.4MP Digital SLR with 2.7 inch LCD and 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 AL Lens (Red)

Reviews.Title: Poor HD movie support, look elsewhere if this is important to you
Reviews.Author: Smarty Shopper
Reviews.Content: Was waiting for Canon to fix some of the poor design aspects of the S90 so I could get a nice high end compact near-DSLR.  Majorly disappointed, the 720p HD movie mode only supports 24fps.  I don't understand why Canon rolls out lower end cameras with high end movie modes, then handicaps their higher end cameras with low end movie modes.  I'll wait for the Panasonic DMC-LX5 or look for something else instead.
